loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nilda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Nilda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell in her rice business.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell in her business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 49 years old, married and has five children, one of whom in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising cows and pigs in the Philippines. Amalia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins.

Amalia has been raising cows and pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Zainab. She is married and has four children who are aged one, eight, fifteen, and eighteen years old. 

In 2007, Zainab, established a provisions shop to sell drinks, sardines, mayonnaise, milk and sugar. She began her business to earn money to help educate her children. She works six days a week and 11 hours a day to earn a monthly income of 875,000 SLL. 

Zainab would like 5,000,000 SLL to buy more drinks, mayonnaise, milk, luncheon meat and sardines. Competition and the rainy season are her big challenges. This business has helped her to raise her children. 

In the future, Zainab plans to build her own house, a bigger shop, and provide a quality education to her children. She hopes that this loan will help develop her business and save enough money for retirement. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, mayonnaise, milk, luncheon meat and sardines.

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en:
Saran’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saran makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Famille Lukogo Group

texts.fr: Employé dans une plantation, Gervais a découvert le secret que la culture du café était intéressante et en a profité pour ramener quelques semences chez lui en guise d'essai. Il s'en est imprégné mais  les limites de cette culture par rapport à son milieu sont le manque de produits phytosanitaires et l'imprécision du lieu d'écoulement. Il souhaite dans les jours à venir trouver une étendue de café suffisante et bien entretenue pour aider sa famille à se développer à tous les niveaux. Il est sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en: Employed on a plantation, Gervais discovered that coffee was interesting and took the opportunity of bringing a few seeds home as a trial enterprise. He has immersed himself in the subject, but is limited in this domestic culture by the lack of phytosanitary products and the difficulties of poor drainage. In the near future he would like to find a sufficiently large and well-tended patch of coffee to help his family to develop in every way. He is with his wife in the photograph.

loans.use: To pay for upkeep, mulching, phytosanitary treatment, and labour for the harvest.

loans.name: Famille Kanyantibiri Group

texts.fr: Après le constat que le café a aidé beaucoup de gens dans le milieu, Sauti a decidé de s'adonner à cette culture à partir de 1989. Cela lui permet désormais de prendre en charge certains besoins de sa famille vu le nombre de ses dépendants. Les obstacles majeurs à cette activité sont le besoin en main d'oeuvre et les multiples travaux champêtres à effectuer. Il a une perspective d'avenir quant à l'assurance de la scolarité de ses enfants et l'achat et la construction d'une nouvelle parcelle. Il pose sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en:
After finding that coffee helps many people in the area, Sauti decided to start farming it in 1989. It allows him to take care of some of his family's needs, given the number of his dependents.

The major challenges to this work is the need for labor and the amount of field work to be done.

For the future, he wants to ensure the schooling of his children and to buy and build [on] a new piece of land.

Sauti is standing in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to maintain a field

loans.name: Famille Koko Group

texts.fr: C'est en 2002 que la famille de Clément a commencé à exploiter le champ de café que lui ont été cédé ses parents. Les travaux d'entretien et de récolte nécessite l'engagement d'une main d'oeuvre pour l'effectuer alors qu'il y a souvent manque d'argent. Il estime que ce crédit lui facilitera la tâche et pourra grâce aux revenus produits, achever les travaux de construction de son chantier. Il est sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en:
In 2002, Clément's family started running the coffee farm that he received from his parents. 

The work to maintain and harvest the land requires additional labor, which Clement often lacks the funds for. He estimates that this loan will pay for this labor, and the earnings from the harvest will help him to complete the construction work at his site.

Clément is standing with his wife in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for labor to farm and harvest a field

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Maria Auxiliadora está en su ciclo número 1º  Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 7 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zulma, quien es vendedora de todo tipo de productos, ya que tiene un copetín bien surtido. Comenta que con esfuerzo  y sacrificio pudo montar su negocio y con ello poder ayudar a su familia. Está esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida e ir capacitándose cada día.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas, yogur, comestibles y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, por poder mejorar su vida. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Maria Auxiliadora is in its 1rst cycle of the Women's Committee Program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, and 7 of the members are below the poverty line. That is, they are in extreme poverty. 

One of the member is Zulma. She sells all types of products, because she has a well stocked store. She says that with hard work and sacrifice she was able to open her business and with it be able to help her family. She is striving to be able to improve her living conditions and be trained every day. 

She is asking for this loan to buy beverages, yogurt, food items and more in order to continue with her sales and improve her life. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy beverages, yogurt, food items and more.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo San  Rafael está formado por 15 integrantes, se encuentran   en  el 9°  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Tomasa.
Ella en su encuesta de eliminación mostró un nivel de pobreza extrema, Tomasa se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, y es con ello que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Comenta que está trabajando arduamente y lucha cada día.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus productos de limpieza, como ser fragancias, lavandinas y otros, y con ello poder seguir luchando por ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The San Rafael group is composed of 15 members. They are in the 9th programme of the women's committee, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are part of the poverty elimination programme where Mrs. Tomasa is one of the members.

In her [poverty] elimination survey she was found to be in extreme poverty. She makes a living from the sale of cleaning products, earning through this activity the means to help her family. She comments that she is working hard and fighting every day.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies to make her cleaning products, such as perfumes, bleach and others, so as to continue fighting to help her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, bleach and other supplies to make cleaning products

loans.name: Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado KYREY está en su 8º ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde desarrollan el trabajo en equipo y la ayuda solidaria. A todas ya se les a aplicado el semáforo dando de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder mejorar sus vidas.
La Sra. Liz, una de las integrantes, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se esfuerza por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio donde vende comidas que ella misma hace y en lo cual es muy buena.  Es una mujer muy luchadora, que quiere ir creciendo, es por ello que se esfuerza cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser: verduras, carnes, hortalizas, condimentos y otros, de manera a poder seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
The group called KYREY is in its 8th cycle of the women's committee program, where they develop their work as a team and with supportive help. All of them have already participated in poverty elimination in order to improve their lives.  

Liz is one of the members. She is a very hardworking woman who is a fighter. She strives to improve her and her family's standard of living. She has a small business where she sells food she makes herself which is very good. She is a woman who is really a fighter who wants to grow. That is why she strives every day. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy materials to make her food such as vegetables, mean, seasonings and more. This way, she can continue working and fighting.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, seasonings and more to make food.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma lives in Tuguegarao with her family. She is 52 years old, married and has four grown up children. Delma manages a store and house for rent. In her store, she sells grocery items such as noodles, eggs, breads, and canned goods. 

Delma aims to improve her sales that is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy additional grocery items to sell. She will buy noodles, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.  Selling additional grocery items will help increase capacity of sales yielding to better profits. She hopes to save funds to further improve her house for rent business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 49 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid two loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan.  She has requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, such as canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 46 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Daisy has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap.

loans.name: Patrocenia

texts.en:
Patrocenia is 46 years old and has six children. Patrocenia is married and has one child in school.

Patrocenia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Patrocenia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Patrocenia has been in this business for a year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Patrocenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 49 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

Delia has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 37-year-old married woman with three children (one child is in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zenaida has a food vending business in the Philippines. Zenaida has been in this business for two years.

Zenaida requested a 8,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Majaila

texts.en:
Majaila is 40 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Previously, Majaila has borrowed and paid back 26 loans from NWTF. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 1 year and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ludmeda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ludmeda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Ludmeda is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Ludmeda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Ecelyn

texts.en:
Ecelyn works hard to support her family. Ecelyn is married and has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Ecelyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ananliza

texts.en:
Ananliza is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ananliza is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ananliza has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Ananliza requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

Ananliza has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ananliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts and pants.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Lenie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Lenie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Charito is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Charito has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Charito requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

Charito has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Charito would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 31-year-old married woman with three children (two children are currently in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alma has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Alma requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase additional materials, such as sand, cement, etc., for her business. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, such as sand, cement, etc., for her business making hollow blocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, dress shirts, pants, and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Para El Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres para el Desarrollo, ya que todas las integrantes buscan poder mejorar su vida y su desarrollo. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Una persona que se destaca es la Sra. Anicia, quien es una humilde venderá de frutas, tiene todo tipo de frutas variadas y que vende de manera ambulante, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos frescos. Ella está luchando para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder ayudar a su familia con esos ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas variadas, como ser manzanas, piñas, melones, sandias, y otros, de manera a poder surtirse y tener una mayor y mejor calidad de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras del grupo están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is named Mujeres para el Desarrollo [Women for Development] since all of its members look to be able to improve their lives and development. They are working through the "Poverty Stoplight" program in order to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One person that stands out is Anicia, who is a humble fruit saleswoman. She has all types of various fruits and sells them as a street vendor. She mentions that she has a very good customer base that always buy fresh products from her. She is striving to become someone in life and to be able to help her family with her income.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy various fruits such as apples, pineapples, melons, watermelons an other fruits to supply her business and have more better quality products to offer to her customers. She is thankful for the opportunity that she and her group members are receiving.

loans.use: to buy apples, pineapples, melons, watermelons an other fruits.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una de las integrantes esta haciendo la encuesta de los 50 indicadores para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder mejorar su situación de vida.
Una persona que se destaca por su esfuerzo y lucha diaria es la Sra. Crispina, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir en un nivel medio, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas que hace va teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Crispina pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para poder vender, como ser remeras, jeans, pantalones, camisas y otros, de manera a poder luchar por mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group forms part of the Elimination of Poverty Program, where each member is carrying out an inquest of 50 indicators in order to understand each person's life situation, and according to these results, to be able to improve their lives.

One person who stands out for her efforts and daily struggle is Crispina. In her latest inquest, she demonstrated a 'poverty level two,' that is a medium level. Through her own efforts and work, she continues to sell clothing and remains able to help her loved ones.

Crispina is requesting this loan to buy various items of clothing to sell, such as T-shirts, jeans, pants, shirts, and other items, in order to strive to improve her income and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts, jeans, pants, shirts and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Némé

texts.fr: Némé femme de 50ans a pour mari un commerçant. Ils ont 02 enfants de 22 et 19ans. elle est commerçante de pagnes dans un marché de la place et est à son quatrième crédit à WAGES. Elle souhaite réinvestir dans l'activité et assurer l'auto-suffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Neme is a 50 year old woman whose husband is a shopkeeper. They have two children of 19 and 22 years old. She sells pagne traditional dresses at a local market and this is her fourth loan from WAGES. She would like to reinvest in her business and ensure her family’s alimentary self-sufficiency.

loans.use: To buy pagne dress fabric.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Elisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell for her used clothing business.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edna is 49 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Edna has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as pants, shirts, etc.

Edna has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as pants, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma,   es de la ciudad de Santaní, casada, está casada, y comenta que es dueña de un salón de belleza, también vende ropas y también tiene servicios de masajes.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que se está esforzando para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Está luchando por poder mejorar su vida e ir creciendo poco a poco.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, para poder vender y crecer en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Norma is from the city of Santaní. She is married, and mentions that she is the owner of a beauty salon. She also sells clothing and offers massages. She is a hard-working and driven woman that is striving to be able to give her family all that she was unable to have. She is working to improve her life and to grow little by little.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various clothing items to then sell and grow her small business.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ingredients for food service.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is thankful that she was granted a PHP 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy ingredients for her peanut butter business. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would now like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to pay for ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, and coconut milk to make peanut butter to sell to the community where she lives. Aside from her peanut butter, she also sells frozen processed foods.

She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial aid that will be given her, for it will be a big help in their daily sustenance and for her children's education.

Marjorie dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a better future. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, sugar, coconut milk, and oil to make peanut butter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Fanta, beer, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, water, cigarettes, biscuits, eggs, body lotion, and shampoo.

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ardiana is 54 years old, and has one child in school.

Ardiana has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy frozen foods to sell in her business.

Ardiana has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods to sell in her business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 50 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Perlita has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Perlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Richelle Jane

texts.en:
Richelle Jane is 34 years old and married with three children, who are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Richelle Jane is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to pays for laborers' salaries for cleaning the farm, and to buy fertilizers.

Richelle Jane has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for cleaning the farm, and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es de la ciudad de Asunción, vive con sus padres y su hermana, actualmente está en el 1er año de la carrera de Enfermería, ella tiene como objetivo culminar la carrera, luego trabajar para dedicarse a lo que le gusta, brindarles servicios sanitarios a las personas. 
Ella cuando termine quiere seguir capacitándose para poder mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Natalia lives in Asuncion with her parents and sister.  She is now in her first year of nursing school and hopes to eventually start a career in nursing.  She likes taking care of people's healthcare needs, she says, and plans to continue developing her skills after she graduates.  

Natalia is applying for a loan that she will use to cover her college costs so that she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to cover college costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy hibiscus flowers.

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.en:
Tranquilina, age 57, is from Migcanaway, Tangub, in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.

PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her sari-sari store business, helping the family survive. She is happy tending her store and earns a good income as well.

Tranquilina is now trying to expand her business and has also decided to venture into a little restaurant. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional inventory for her store and pay for raw ingredients and cooking materials for her little restaurant.

She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build good business management for her loyal customers.

With her extra income, she hopes to provide her family a decent and comfortable living and wishes to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her store and pay for raw ingredients and cooking materials for her little restaurant.

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina earns an income through selling various seafood such as crabs and shrimp. She also produces shrimp pastes to sell.

Peregrina is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to be used as additional working capital to purchase more stock of a variety of seafood to expand her business and increase her production. She is on her way to repaying her loan from her new profits.

She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seafood to increase her inventory and sales.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 35 years old and has one child.

Analisa is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Analisa has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Analisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid three loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) before this loan. She has requested a 18,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, noodles, etc. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.es:
Jonas es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería comercial, y comenta que después de terminar su carrera quiere poder seguir estudiando y aumentar sus conocimientos.
Es una persona que se esfuerza por poder ser alguien en la vida y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Jonas is from the city of Paraguarí.  He is studying Engineering and says that he plans to go on building his skills after he graduates.  He is striving to be someone and to help those dear to him.

Jonas is applying for a loan that he will use to cover his college costs.  The investment will allow him to continue his studies.

loans.use: to cover college costs.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Oñondivepa está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación donde 
una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antonia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ha mejorado su situación de vida a  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de prendas varias que hace, con ello va mejorando cada vez más sus condiciones de vida.
También se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, que hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exige y al mismo tiempo incentiva a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Antonia pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias, como ser jeans, camisas, remeras y otros, de manera a poder seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para poder crecer.
texts.en:
The group named Oñondivepa is in its third cycle of the program that is committed to women, where they all work and help each other to get ahead.  They are doing the survey to eliminate poverty.  

One of the members is Señora Antonia, who is in her final survey.  She has a level of poverty inside of level three, meaning that she has improved her situation of life through effort, continuous work, and through the sales of various kinds of clothing.  With that, she continues improving more each time on her live conditions.

Also, one should note the work of the Foundation of Paraguay which constantly monitors the training and checks in someway the demands, and at the same time encourages the women to fight to be able to overcome poverty.  

Señora Antonia is requesting this loan to buy various clothing, like jeans, shirts, t-shirts, and others, so that she can continue working and fighting each day to grow.

loans.use: To buy jeans, shirts, t-shirts, and others.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena vive con su  familia conformada por tres integrantes, se dedica a la cobranza de una cooperativa y también tiene una bodega, y también estudia. Es una persona que se está esforzando mucho por salir adelante.
Sus aspiraciones son la de ejercer la contabilidad, ya que esa es la carrera que está estudiando, poder abrirse camino y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de escuela, y con ello poder seguir con su lucha.
texts.en:
Lorena is from a family of three.  She works as a cashier for a cooperative and has a small grocery, as well.  She has high hopes for her future and is studying for a degree in Accounting, a career that will open many doors down the line.

Lorena is applying for a loan that she will use to cover her college costs.  The investment will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to cover college costs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida está estudiando para mejorar su calidad de vida, ser alguien importante, y poder ayudar a su familia.
Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería en química industrial, y con ello quiere poder abrirse camino y ayudar a las personas de la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus sueños.
texts.en:
Zenaida is going to college because she wants to improve her quality of life, be someone important, and help her family.  She is studying for a degree in Chemical Engineering because she wants both a good career and skills that are socially-useful.  

Zenaida is applying for a loan to cover her college costs.  The investment will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to cover her college costs.

loans.name: Asterio

texts.es:
Asterio está cursando el último año de la carrera Lic. en Educación. Su prioridad es terminar sus estudios, poder ayudar a sus familias, y también poder ayudar a las personas que al igual que él quiera estudiar.
Está poniendo todo su esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder cumplir con sus metas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir con su lucha.
texts.en:
Asterio is in his final year at college.  He is studying for a degree in Education and says that his main priority is to finish his degree so that he can help his family and others like him who want to get an education.  He is putting all of his effort to being someone in life and meeting his goals.

Asterio is applying for a loan that he will use to cover his college costs.  The investment will allow him to continue his studies.

loans.use: to cover his college costs.

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is from Tangub, in the Philippines. She and her husband have agricultural land and earn a living through farming. May makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently requested a loan from Paglaum MPC to pay for making holes and planting more cassava seedlings on her land. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply cassava in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for making holes and planting more cassava seedlings on her land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Katamé Group

texts.fr: Fatimata et les autres membres du groupe sont des femmes dynamiques qui exercent des activités diversifiées. Fatimata est une vendeuse de pagnes et de bijoux. Elle est mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Cette brave dame a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter plus d'article pour vendre à sa clientèle. Avec son bénéfice, elle pourrait gérer sa petite famille et continuer son activité.
texts.en: Fatimata and the other members of the group are energetic women who have diverse businesses. Fatimata is a vendor of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and jewelry. She is the mother of two children, both in school. This good and honest woman has need of this loan to purchase more items to sell to her customers. With her profits, she would be able to manager her small family and to continue her business.

loans.use: to our 'pagne' cloth and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Benedicta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Benedicta is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Benedicta has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Govinda Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Namita, aged about 40 years, is a unique lady in the IRC Viilage, Bhubaneswar, Khurdha, Odisha, India. Namita has a family with her husband and only two daughters. She has been engaged by herself with tailoring at her own home in IRC Village. She is the one who is sitting in the middle in front of the sewing machine. Also, she is a perfect member of her village Govinda Group which was founded in the year 2014 and contains five members. They all are engaged with their own businesses. Mrs. Namita is one of them who has has taken on a great task to improve their livelihood and living conditions.

Mrs. Namita has been working in tailoring for 12 years. Through concerted work she earns a monthly income of Rs.9,000. Her opinion is that the income earned is not sufficient to maintain her family in a smooth manner, with sufficient surplus to invest in the business and materialize her dreams. So to get more income through the expansion of her business, she plans to improve her business over the course of this loan, planning to purchase another stitching machine, thread, cloth and related items from the nearest market after disbursement of the loan. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the construction of a house for her children.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their businesses like vegetable vending, milk business, gold smith and tailoring occupations, hoping to boost their livelihoods after loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase another stitching machine, thread, cloth and related items

loans.name: Divincet

texts.en:
Divincet is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Divincet is 39 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Divincet has a bakery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like flour, margarine, sugar, butter, etc. for her business.

Divincet has been in this business for three years. In the future, Divincet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, margarine, sugar, butter, etc. for her business

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carmencita is 60 years old now.

Carmencita has a seaweed business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production.

Carmencita has been in this business for one year. In the future, Carmencita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a 26-year-old woman who is married with one child and lives in a community within the Honiara city.

She runs a small canteen, selling items such as tuna, noodles,tomato source, toiletries and other household items and has been doing this for 1 years.
All along she has planned to buy a deep freezer for her canteen. With her loan she will buy a new large deep freezer that will enable her to sell drinks and other frozen food like chicken, mince and sausage.

She strongly believes that with her future loan she will expand her business and provide a better living for her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer for her small canteen

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and married with 4 children, living on the outskirts of Honiara town.

She makes and sells cakes and muffins to her community to earn a living and has been doing this for almost a year. 

Rose’s current utensils are worn out so she needs a loan to buy a new oven and other baking stuff like flour, cooking oil, yeast, and containers.

She believes that, with her profit and accessing more loans, she will be able to provide a better living for her family and also to generate another business and to become a successful business woman in the future. She has been a SPBD member since 2014.

loans.use: To buy a new baking oven and new utensils

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 40 years old, married with three children, and lives outside Honiara town.

She runs a poultry business where she feeds laying chickens and sells the eggs in her community to earn a living. Now she is waiting for her old birds to be slaughtered and will then buy new ones. With her loan she is preparing to buy 250 new broilers (6-week-old chicks) and the chicken feeds (starter, finisher). She has been doing this for two years.

She believes that her profit and future loan will enable her to build a permanent home for her family and provide a better education for children. She has been an SPBD member since 2013.

loans.use: to buy new broilers (6-week-old chicks)

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 57 years old and is married with 9 children. She lives in a community within the Honiara town.

She runs a business tailoring clothes such as dresses, skirts and pillow cases to sell to her comment, thereby earning a living.  She has eight years of experience in this business. 

She found it difficult to sew some patterns using a hand sewing machine by herself.  So Caroline has requested a loan to buy a zigzag sewing machine  and other sewing material like Scissors, bobbins, needles, taking pin, cotton, elastic rubber and cloths materials.

She strongly believes that with her profit and accessing a loan will really help her to pay for her children’s education fees, provide household needs and improver her family's living standards. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy a new zigzag sewing machine and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 34 years old and married with four children. She lives outside the Honiara city. 

She buys wet cocoa beans from the community and sells them to the cocoa agents to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year now. Her business has grown, and there is not enough space to store her wet beans, so Ruth requested her second loan to buy rolls of nets and timber to improve her drier and build a storage box for her cocoa beans.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. She believes that accessing loans will help her future plans to expand her business, pay her children's school fees and provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to improve her cocoa-beans business

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
Beverlyn is a 43-year-old married woman with 5 children, and she lives in a remote community outside Honiara town.

She runs a piggery farm for a living. She has been doing this for almost two years now. Currently, she has only one pig left, so she needed a loan to buy three more pigs and fencing materials, wire, nails, and a wheelbarrow to improve her piggery house.  

She has been a SPBD member since 2014 and she believes that her future loan will enable her to extend her piggery house and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To improve and expand her piggery farm

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 28 years old and married with two children, living on the outskirts of the main city.

She has a small cocoa plantation and buys cocoa beans to earn a living. She has been doing this for two year now. 

She plans to improve her business, so Agnes requested a loan to buy timber, knives, bags, and other cocoa trimming tools. She has been a member of SPBD in 2014. With her profit she plans to improve her cocoa plantation and expand her business. 

She believes taking future loans will enable her to build a better home for her family and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To improve her cocoa business

loans.name: Dacilyn

texts.en:
Dacilyn is 43 years old and is married with 5 children. She lives outside Honiara city.

To sustain her family's needs, Dacilyn owns and operates a small petrol shed. She used her loan to buy fuel to sell to members of her community. She has been doing this for a year.

Dacilyn believes that with her profits, and through access to future loans, she will be able to both expand her fuel shed business and also build a small shop next door. This will help her earn greater profits and provide a good education for her children as well as meet other family demands. 

Dacilyn has been a member of South Pacific Business Development since 2014.

loans.use: to purchase fuel to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 38-year-old woman who is married with four children and lives outside Honiara city.

She runs a poultry business, and to earn extra income she also does marketing of cooked foods and sells them to her community. She has been doing this for 1 years. With her profit she manages to pay for her children education and other family demands.

Rose needs a loan to buy 120 broilers (day-old chicks), chicken feeds such as starter, grower, and finisher ,and also some poultry supplies like drinker and feeder (feeding container).

She believes that her profit and accessing a future loan will enable her to provide a better education for her children and also improve her family's living conditions. She has been an SPBD member since 2013.

loans.use: to pay for 120 broilers (day-old chicks) and their feeds (starter, grower and finisher).

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina, a 27-year-old married woman, lives in a remote community outside the town of Honiara. For the past year Tina has been running a piggery farm to earn a living. Currently she has only one mother pig with her four piglets, but plans to expand her enterprise.

A SPBD member since 2013, Tina has requested a loan to buy six piglets, a mill run, copra run and fish run. She believes that her profits and future loans will enable her to extend her piggery house and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy six piglets, a mill run, copra run and fish run for her piggery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Faustina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de medias de alpaca, venta de condimentos, venta de ropa, venta de muebles, venta de DVD’s, venta de calzados, venta de artefactos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Faustina es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio taller de carpintería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo, quien trabajaba con este negocio, al casarse decide emprender un negocio independiente, ya que conocía la metodología de trabajo y como adquirir la materia prima. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera por mayor) que adquirirá de las barracas mayoristas de la de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tienen tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. Hormiguitas (The Little Ants) will begin its 14th cycle in Pro Mujer (Pro Women), as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch.  It is made up of ten members and is headed by a board where Señora Faustina is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal association are varied among them.  Selling alpaca socks, selling condiments, selling clothing, selling furniture, selling DVD's, selling shoes, and selling artifacts.

The loan that they took out will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs where Señora Faustina is a member.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago, joining by the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a carpentry workshop.  One should know that she learned this business from her husband, who worked with this job.  Upon getting married, she decided to start an independent business since she knew the methodology of the work and who to acquire the materials. 

The loan that she now took out is to increase the capital (to buy the wood wholesale) that she will acquire of the wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz and later make and sell it in her stall.  This job allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is married and they have three children.

She asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: Compra de madera por mayor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April is 27 years old, single and lives with her parents in Tangub, Philippines. She is a diligent and determined daughter when it comes to the welfare of her parents, and she wants to provide the best for them. 

April earns a living by making snacks that she sells and also on consignment in shops and cafes. She decided to expand her business after learning that she could obtain financial assistance through PMPC. Consequently, she has requested a 6,000 PHP loan to buy additional ingredients to increase production. Her goal is to be able to display her snacks in every shop and place to eat in the area.

With the help and support of her parents,  April smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients to increase production

loans.name: Selfa

texts.en:
Selfa is 22 years old. She is married and the family lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative. 

Recently, Selfa is accessing her second loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP  for additional working capital of her existing business to buy a variety of commodities. She sells a variety of consumable items in the local community.

loans.use: to buy variety of commodities.

loans.name: Glemarie

texts.en:
Glemarie is living with her parents in Talic, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She is 29 years old and single. Glemarie manages a direct-selling business. She sells products for men, women and children like soap, lotion, perfume, clothes, footwear, cosmetics and others. She has had this business for one year. She found it interesting because she can earn income in an easy way through her good and effective salesmanship. 

Glemarie requested a loan to purchase more stock to offer more to her customers. Expanding her inventory would also mean an increase to her income. Glemarie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to arrange a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to offer more to her customers.

loans.name: Lane

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Lane is borrowing 18,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more boxes of herbal medicine to sell for her buy and sell herbal medicine business.

Lane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 59 years old and married with eight children. 

Arsenia is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Arsenia requested a 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

Arsenia has been raising chickens for 10 years now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Arsenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 53 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Amelia has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Gouri Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Gouri, aged about 40,  is a unique lady in the Ganganagar, Bhubaneswar, Khurdha, Odisha, India. Gouri has a family with four sons and only one daughter. She has been engaged by herself with tailoring at her own home in Ganganagar. She is standing in the middle with raised hand in the photo. Also, she is a perfect member of her village group called Gouri. This was founded in the year 2014 and contains five members. They all are engaged with their own businesses. Mrs. Gouri, is one who has taken on a great task to improve their livelihood and living conditions. 

Mrs. Gouri has been engaged in tailoring for 10 years. Through concerted work she earns a monthly income of Rs.7,000. Her opinion is that this income is not sufficient to maintain her family in a smooth manner, with sufficient surplus forl investment in the business and to materialize her dreams. So to get more income by expansion of her business, she planned to improve her business in the course of the loan, planning to purchase another stitching machine, thread, cloth and related items from the nearest market post disbursement of the loan .She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of a house.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their businesses like vegetable vending, milk business and tailoring occupations, and hope to boost their livelihoods after loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase another stitching machine, thread, cloth and related items

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estrella is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Estrella has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 9,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Estrella has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Elenita requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bread production business. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Elenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bread production business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 47 years old and has five children. She is widowed and two of her children are currently in school.

Elvira is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs. Elvira has been in pig fattening for 11 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Amigas De Nasca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE NASCA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de CD y DVD’s, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que fue a su domicilio a invitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que apoyaba en el negocio familiar, actualmente comercializa sus productos en otro departamento, realizando viajes constantemente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Amigas de Nasca" (Friends of Nasca) will begin its third cycle in Pro Mujer (Pro Women), as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II.  It is comprised of eleven members, and it is headed by a board where Señora Lidia is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal association are varied among them.  Selling vegetables, selling food, selling blankets, selling CD's and DVD's, and selling shoes.

The loan that they took out will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs where Señora Lidia is a member.  She say that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, joining by the invitation of an adviser who went to her home to invite her.  Today, she has a business selling vegetables.  One should know that she learned she business from her mother, since she used to support the family business.  Currently, she sells her products in another region, traveling constantly. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase the capital (to buy vegetables wholesale) that she will acquire from wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz and later sell in her stall.  This job allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Simón

texts.es:
El Sr. Simón, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, en su casa, en la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Él está trabajando en el servicio de aguatería desde hace varios años.
Es una persona muy luchadora, que formo hace varios años una aguatería llamada “Aguason”, con la cual provee a sus vecinos y otros clientes de zonas aledañas, con algo tan importante, como ser el agua.
El quiere seguir ofreciendo un servicio de calidad a sus clientes, es por ello que pide este préstamo, para poder invertirlo en la refacción de motores que usa en su aguatería, de manera a poder seguir mejorando cada día para dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Simón is married. He lives with his wife and children in his house in the city of Villa Elisa. For the past several years, he has worked providing water reservoir services. He is a very determined person who established a water reservoir called "Aguason" several years ago, with which he provides his neighbors and other customers in the surrounding areas with something as important as water.

He wishes to continue offering a quality service to his customers. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to repair the engines of his water reservoir. This way, he can continue improving every day in order to offer a better service.

loans.use: to repair the engines of his water reservoir.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie earns an income through selling various food commodities in the local community. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC, and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, Virgie applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and additional hollow blocks for house repairs. She is on her way to repairing her house. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and additional hollow blocks for house repairs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children, who are now adults. Gloria earns a living from her sari sari (variety) store business. She's been doing this business for 22 years already. She earns approximately 3,500 PHP each month.

Gloria has requested a loan to be used in purchasing three sacks of rice, two sacks of pollard feed, and assorted groceries for retail. She has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of rice, two sacks of pollard feed, and assorted groceries to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is married and lived in Piat with her family. She had three children. 

To gain income, she operates a store selling grocery items and also retails rice for additional income. She wanted to increase her sales and income, that is why she wans to sell more merchandise to get more profits from it. 

So she is now borrowing a loan of P15,000 to buy sardines, eggs, bread, and soft drinks to sell. She will also buy cavans of rice to sell. 

Susana hopes to keep improving the flow of her business and continue to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy sardines, eggs, bread and soft drinks

loans.name: Jennylen

texts.en:
Jennylen is 27 years old and has four children. Jennylen is a woman and her four children are in school.

Jennylen is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jennylen has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennylen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 36 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, chips, soap, etc. 

Elsie has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, chips, soap, etc

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Eva requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her business. She has been in business for eight years now. In the future, Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Bebe Arene

texts.en:
Bebe Arene is 36 years old and has four children. Bebe Arene is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Bebe Arene is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Bebe Arene has been in pig fattening for eight years now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 51-year-old married woman with eight children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines, running a fishing business.

She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials that she needs for her business.

Leonida has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials that she needs for her business

loans.name: Firilyn

texts.en:
Firilyn is 23 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Firilyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is 55 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Felina runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, bread, eggs, etc. 

Felina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza is 41 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Rizza has been in this business for five years. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
Mirabel is 27 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Mirabel runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her business like bread, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Mirabel has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Mirabel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her business like bread, eggs, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 46 years old and married with nine children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like junk food, canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for nine years, and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like junk food, canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Riskiniso

texts.en:
Riskiniso is a hardworking and goal oriented woman. Her family is not big and she has two daughters. She divorced from her husband. Her daughters are married. She lives with her brother and sister-in-law in a house in a rural area. She wants to be supported and needs the relationship with relatives, because she feels alone herself.

She has land where she is planning to plant potatoes and gain a good harvest. Recently she has gained livestock for trade. She keeps feed and sells well and has practice in agriculture.

Riskiniso has not enough money to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. She awaits KIVA lenders' mercy and asks financial support.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Segundo Antonio

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 53 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, realiza esta actividad desde hace 02 años contando con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y clientes. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su mototaxi ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Segundo espera mejorar los servicios que brinda lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 53 years old, is single, and live in his own house in the district of Cayaltí which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.  The citizens of this district work mainly in agriculture and raising animals.

He makes a living providing transportation on his motor taxi.  He has been doing this job for two years, counting on good references from his neighbors and customers.  

He is requesting this loan to make repairs and maintenance on his motor taxi since it is currently in bad condition.  With this Segundo hopes to improve the services that he offers so that it will have a positive impact on his level of income and will increase his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To make repairs and maintenance on his motor taxi that is currently in bad condition.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Expedito, es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, son mujeres del mismo barrio, demuestran mucha unidad y solidaridad entre ellas. 
La señora Sergia es integrante de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, quien planea comprar pollos y chanchos para poder criarlos y venderlos de tal manera a poder ayudar a su familia.
Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe, de poder crecer por medio del programa de comité de mujeres.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Expedito" is from the city of San Ignacio. It is composed of women from the same neighborhood who have shown great unity and solidarity among themselves.

Sergia is a member of this group. She is a very hard-working and determined woman who plans to buy chickens and pigs for breeding and sale so that she can help her family. She is grateful for the opportunity to grow that she is being given through the women committee program.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs for breeding and sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing 23,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gina has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosanna is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosanna has a poultry business in the Philippines. Rosanna requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to use in her business. Rosanna has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Rosanna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to manage and harvest their field.

loans.name: Wilman

texts.es: William de 30 años de edad, es  experto en carpintería. Él habita en el municipio de Baranoa con su familia y tiene 8 años de experiencia en este oficio. Aún recuerda como en el año 2007 inició, buscando clientes propios,  después de trabajar con su padre quien le ofreció toda su experiencia en las técnicas y el comercio de artículos de madera. Hoy  William hace mantenimiento y reparación de muebles, además de fabricar mesas, sillas, y artículos domésticos o educativos en general, desde su propio taller, ubicado en la vivienda donde habita.  . Su meta es que su taller se encuentre completamente equipado, para mejorar los tiempos productivos y prestar un mejor servicio, pues necesita aumentar sus ventas y esto es un gran desafío. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará madera en un mayor volumen, para ofrecer el servicio a todo costo, pues en la actualidad vende de contado y maneja algunos créditos con sus clientes y estas son circunstancias que requieren mejorar para incrementar el volumen de compradores, para lograr finalmente que su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
William is 30 years old.  He is an expert in carpentry.  He lives in the town of Baranoa with his family, and he has eight years of experience in his job.  He still remembers how in 2007 he began, looking for his own customers, after working with his father who gave him all of his experience in the techniques and the selling of wood products.

Today William does maintenance and repairs on furniture, in addition to making tables, chairs, and domestic and educational products in general, from his own workshop, located in the house where he lives.

His goal is that his workshop be completely equipped, to improve the production times and give better service.  Therefore, he needs to increase his sales and this is a great challenge.  Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, first financing that the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo does, through which he will buy the wood in a greater volume, to offer the service at all costs.  Currently he sells in cash and manages a few credits with his customers, and these are circumstances that require improvement to increase the volume of buyers, to finally make his Kiva credit a successful investment.

loans.use: To buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aileen is 22 years old now.

Aileen has a seaweed business in the Philippines. Aileen requested a 6,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Aileen has been in this business for one year. In the future, Aileen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business

loans.name: Relwendé Group

texts.fr: Alimata, membre représentatif de ce groupe est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Ses enfants sont respectivement âgés de 20, 17, 11, 9 ans et tous vont à l'école. Cette brave dame vend des chaussures, des sacs, des bijoux et des glacières depuis 13 ans. Le groupe d'Alimata est un bon groupe qui fait ses remboursements à la bonne date. Alimata vient d'ouvrir un nouvelle boutique dans laquelle, elle compte installer un congélateur pour vendre de l'eau glace en cette période où il fait chaud au Burkina. Elle a besoin du prêt pour renforcer ses  activités. Vu le volume de ses activités, Alimata compte employer 2 personnes pour la gestion de sa boutique.
