A l'issue de ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de continuer son activité mais surtout s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Alimata is the representative member of this group and is married with four children. Her children are aged 20, 17, 11 and nine and they all attend school. This good lady has been selling shoes, bags, jewellery and coolers for 13 years. Alimata's group is a good group, they repay their loans punctually. Alimata has just opened a new shop where she plans to install a freezer so that she can sell iced water during this hot season in Burkina. She needs the loan to reinforce her business. In view of the size of her business, Alimata intends to employ two people to manage her shop. After her sales, her profits will enable her to continue her business and above all to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy pagne dresses, bags, jewellery and coolers for resale.

loans.name: Kisa

texts.en:
Kisa is a 45-year-old mother with 6 children. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 5 years.

Kisa has requested for a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna, plastic bags, a container, butter, and mayonnaise, and timber and cement for home improvement. She will expand her business using her profit. Kisa became a member of SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her sandwich business, and timber and cement.

loans.name: Bellarina

texts.en:
Bellarina is 22 years old. She runs a small business of selling ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Bellarina has requested for a loan to buy a freezer, a sack of sugar, plastic bags, an ice bag, etc. to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business in her community. Bellarina became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, sack of sugar, plastic bags, etc. to make ice cakes.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras está formado por 17 integrantes, están en  el noveno ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante .Se encuentran en el programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les permite conocer la situación de vida de cada una y con ello poder mejorar.
La Sra. Karina integra este grupo, ella en su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró estar en un nivel de pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la venta de sábanas, edredones, y colchas; así también a la venta de ropas.
La Sra. Karina solicita este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas, como ser jeans, camisas, remeras, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Entrepreneurial Women) is composed of 17 members. They are in their ninth cycle of the women committee program, through which they work and help each other in order to move forward. They are also in the poverty elimination program, which allows them to explore the life situation of each member and, that way, to improve.

Karina is a members of this group. In her poverty elimination survey, she revealed that she is at a level of extreme poverty. She makes a living selling sheets, comforters, and bedspreads. She also sells clothing.

Karina is requesting a loan to buy a variety of clothes such as jeans, blouses, shirts, pants, and others. This way, she will be able to continue fighting to improve her life conditions and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy jeans, blouses, shirts, pants, and others.

loans.name: Arroyo Capilla Group

texts.es:
El comité de Jóvenes llamado ARROYO CAPILLA está conformado por 9 integrantes que apuntan a una mejor y buena calidad de vida, ellos se han unido para poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos.
Uno de los integrantes es el Joven Gabriel, él es huérfano de padre y madre, y está a cargo de una familia bondadosa que lo acogió y gracias a su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de dicha familia sigue estudiando, Él vende chipas para poder mantenerse, y es también vendedor ambulante, es muy activo en su comité.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipas para poder vender y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Youth Committee known as ARROYO CAPILLA [Chapel Stream] is made up of 9 members who strive for a better quality of life. They have gotten together to be able to help their families and loved ones.

One of the members is the young Gabriel. He is an orphan, and is being cared for by a kind-hearted family who took him in. Thanks to his efforts and with the help of this family, he is still studying.

He sells chipas [cheesy buns] in order to support himself, and is a street vendor. He is very active on his committee.

He is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying chipas to sell and continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy chips [cheesy buns] to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy petrol.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is it her hobby, she earns an income as well. Restituta is a widow, and she busies herself to sufficiently provide for her needs and support her grandchildren as well.

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

In the future, Restituta wishes nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life with adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Ma. Precie

texts.en:
Ma. Precie is a 45-year-old, married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. Ma. Precie is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Ma. Precie requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business. Ma. Precie has been in this business for ten years. 

In the future, Ma. Precie would like to save money in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Meet Beatrice, a resilient entrepreneur who is actively involved in many income-generating activities, the main one being agriculture.

Beatrice lives on a small plot of land in Lolminingai village. She started with next to nothing and five years later, she is keeping poultry and growing maize for commercial purposes. She also owns a small business that brings in some extra profit.

Beatrice is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Maize farming is bringing her a good income but the only problem is that it is a seasonal product. She is seeking to expand her poultry farming because the product is doing great in the market and the income is regular. Poultry farming sustains her family as she waits for the produce to be ready for the market.

With your funding, Beatrice is going to use the income from your investment to repay the loan and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
The lack of capital has been a great worry in the life of Sally, a woman who is dedicated in body and soul to agriculture. 

For the past ten year, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Sally says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows.  She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10-15 litres of milk a day, and this helps her support her family. 

Sally also practices crop farming. She has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. . This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through this loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. 

Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profit levels. Sally is very visionary.  Her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. 

Sally believes that through this loan, she will be able to turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Sally’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Gina Rubie

texts.en:
Gina Rubie is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Gina Rubie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina Rubie has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina Rubie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase his herd

loans.name: Gulnura

texts.ru: Гулнура, 36 лет, в разводе, мать шестилетнего сына. У нее высшее образование, работает адвокатом, оказывая юридические услуги. В поиске доходов для своей семьи Гулнура стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес начала с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду Гулнура достигла больших успехов и получает прибыль в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На сегодняшний день у Гулнуры есть лошадь и 2 коровы, на участке мерою 2,0 Га собственной земли она выращивает клевер. Гулнура обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гулнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своей деятельности, она хочет накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Gulnura is 36 years old, divorced, and the mother of a six-year-old son. She has a higher education and works as a lawyer, offering legal services. In search of income for her family, Gulnura got involved in raising livestock and crops. The business started with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her backbreaking work, Gulnura achieved big success and gets income of 25,000 som (KGS) per month. Today, Gulnura has a horse and two cows and on a plot measuring 2.0 hectares of her own land, she grows clover. Gulnura applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow for fattening and resale.

Gulnura plans to invest income from the loan in further developing her activities. She wants to save up to buy an automobile.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Sabirinisa

texts.ru: Сабириниса, 23 года, замужем, есть 2 детей. У Сабиринисы средне-специальное образование. На данный момент она занимается сельским хозяйством, в качестве дополнительного дохода. Стартовав 4 года назад, благодаря упорному труду Сабиринисы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 7 овец. На 2,0 Га она выращивает рис и кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сабириниса обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита позволят Сабиринисе развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Sabirinisa is 23 years old, married, and has two children. Sabirinisa has a specialized secondary education. Currently, she is engaged in agriculture as an additional source of income. Starting four years ago, Sabirinisa through her hard work now has on her homestead two cows and seven sheep. On 2.0 hectares, she grows rice and corn for sale. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further devleloping her homestead, Sabirinisa applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase three cows. Profits from the loan will allow Sabirinisa to develop her business and to improve the family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Zuura

texts.ru: Зуура, 50 лет, замужем, 5 детей (3 сыновей, 2 дочери). Зуура на протяжении 6 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, также выращивает кукурузу и клевер на 0,7 Га земли. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Зуура хочет увеличить поголовье скота, за счет покупки теленка.  Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS). В будущем, она мечтает отдать дочь в хороший университет, женить сыновей.
texts.en:
Zuura is 50 years old, married, and has five children (3 sons and 2 daughters). For the last six years, Zuura has been raising cattle and crops. Currently, she has two cows and ten sheep, and also grows corn and clover on 0.7 hectares of land. Monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). Zuura wants to increase her livestock count, through the purchase of a calf. She applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS).

In the future, she dreams of sending her daughter to a good university and marrying off her sons.

loans.use: to buy one calf in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Setu

texts.en:
Setu is a 29-year-old mother with 2 children and has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Setu has requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves, and safety boots to assist her in running the business. Setu hopes to expand her business by using her profit in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, etc. for her business selling vegetables.

loans.name: Joyci Grace

texts.en:
Joyci Grace is 33 years old and lives in Pagadian, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four children.

She has a furniture shop, making and selling various furniture items. Her shop also offers services like wood carving and molding. She has had this business for years.

Joyci Grace has been a member of PMPC for three years now. She has requested a loan to add to her inventory of wood so that she can produce more varieties of furniture. In the future, she hopes to own a furniture showroom to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for producing more varieties of furniture

location.town: Pagadian Lantian, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer for her rice field.

Vilma has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Noemilita

texts.en:
Noemilita is 56 years old and has nine children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Noemilita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Noemilita has been farming rice for 18 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Noemilita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 62 years old and has eight children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Yolanda is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Yolanda has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and both of her children are in school.

Vivian has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like dried fish, canned goods, snack foods and other groceries to sell.

Vivian has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like dried fish, canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. to sell.

loans.name: Ananya Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sili, age about 23, is an exclusive lady in Mahavir Basti, Bhubaneswar, Khurdha, Odisha, India. Sili has a small family comprising her husband and only one daughter. Sili is engaged in professional tailoring at her own home of Mahaveer Basti. The person sitting in front of all the group members with a raised hand is Sili.

Also, she is an ideal member of her village Joint Liability Group (JLG), namely Ananya, which was formed in the year 2014 and contains five members. Under the JLG, they all are engaged with their own professions and businesses. Mrs. Sili is one of them who has taken a great role to play with an object to improve their livelihoods and professional lives.

Mrs. Sili has been engaged in a tailoring occupation at her own home of Mahaveer Basti village for five years. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of Rs. 6,500. Her opinion is that, though this income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus and total investment in the business, she will be able to materialize her dreams.

So, to get more and more income by expansion of her business, she planned to improve her business in the course of the loan. This resulted in taking the loan to purchase another sewing machine, cloth, more thread, and other related items from the nearest market after the disbursement of the loan. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion, save money for construction of a house, and provide better education to her daughter.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their professions: vegetable vending, a milk business, snacks-stall business, and stationery business. With this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods after the loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine, cloth, more thread, and other related items.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 39 years old and a married woman with three children. All of her children are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marichu has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy groceries like canned goods, coffee, milk, salt and spices.

Marichu has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy groceries like canned goods, coffee, milk, salt and spices.

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 48 лет, замужем. У них с мужем 4 детей. Анаркан с мужем в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1990 году начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 6 коров, 10 овец, и 2,0 Га обрабатываемой земли, где растет люцерна. Ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум » за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки дополнительных голов скота и для улучшения материального благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Anarkan is 48 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. As a main source of income for their family, Anarkan and her husband in 1990 began to raise crops and livestock, starting this work with 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Anarkan currently has on her homestead six cows and ten sheep. She also has 2.0 hectares of prepared land where she grows alfalfa. Monthly income from the farm amounts to about 5,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her business, Anarkan applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock to increase her headcount.

Anarkan plans to invest profits from the loan in developing the business through the purchase of additional heads of cattle and to improve the material well-being of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy personal hygiene items, drinks and food items wholesale

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль, 42 года, замужем, муж на пенсии, много лет проработал в гос. органах, дети живут с Айгуль. У нее высшее образование, очень целеустремленная, трудолюбивая и ответственная. Уже 10 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Айгуль есть 12 овец, корова. На 3,0 Га арендованной и 1,48 Га собственной земли выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячная прибыль Айгуль составляет около 18,700 сом (KGS). Айгуль решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки земли и выплату арендной платы за поливную землю. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и постройку забора.
texts.en:
Aigul is 42 years old and married. Her husband is retired and for many years worked in state bodies. The children live with Aigul. She has a higher education. She is very determined, hardworking and responsible. For ten years, she has been involved in raising livestock and crops. On her homestead, Aigul has 12 sheep and a cow. On 3.0 hectares of rented land and 1.48 hectares of her own land, she grows beans. Aigul's monthly income amounts to about 18,700 som (KGS).

Aigul decided to apply to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase fertilizers for preparing the land and to pay rent for irrigated land. She plans to invest profits from the loan in further augmenting her business and building a fence.

loans.use: to pay rent for land and to buy fertilizers for cultivation and growing organic haricot.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 44 years old and married.

Rosalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Rosalia has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, shampoo, diapers and other groceries.

In the future Rosalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luluama

texts.en:
Luluama is a 38-year-old mother with three children. She owns and operates a small business selling pancake, pork cake, and buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

To  assist her in running the business, Luluama has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, a frying pan, and a container. She hopes to use her profit to build a small bakery store in the near future. Luluama joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, a frying pan, and a container

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani is a 45-year-old mother with two children. She runs a small business selling tuna sandwiches and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

To assist her in running her business, Leilani has requested a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna fish, plastic bags, a container, butter, and mayonnaise. She will expand her business using her profit. Leilani became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna fish, plastic bags, a container, butter, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Lekea

texts.en:
Lekea is a 53 year old mother with 6 children. She operates a small business cooking and selling BBQ in her community to earn a living.

Lekea has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausages, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, a sack of rice, etc to help her run the business.

Lekea hopes to build a small restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, a box of sausages, mushroom soy sauce, onions, plates, aluminum foil, bananas, a sack of rice etc.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is a 23-year-old mother with one child. She runs a small business selling bananas and taro chips in her village and at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Telesia has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, and plastic bags to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a chips store in the near future and provide for her family needs. Telesia became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a bottle of vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de busos, venta de ropa, venta de alcohol, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de busos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucha es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que me encontró en un bloqueo y me intereso la forma de trabajo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de busos de lana; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años aprendiendo en una institución técnica, posteriormente al reunir un monto de capital decide implementar un negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad de la obtención del crédito, el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal loan group "FLOR KANTUTA" is beginning their sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. The group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Lucha is the President. The businesses of the members of the group are varied, including: selling sweatsuits, selling clothing, selling alcohol, selling clothing, a neighborhood grocery store, selling blankets, selling sweaters, and selling sweatsuits. 

Their loan will benefit small businesses, one of which is Lucha's. She tells us that she has been a part of Pro Mujer for six years, having joined at the invitation of one of the institution's advisors, as she was in a blocked situation and this kind of work interested her. She now has a business making wool sweatsuits, and says that she started the business several years ago, studying at a technical institution. After gathering capital, she decided to start a business.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital for buying wool wholesale, which she will get from the sellers in the city of El Alto, and later, after making the sweatsuits, she will sell them in her place of sales. This way of working allows her to make money to give her family economic support, as she is married and has four children.

 When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lucha says that she likes the ease of obtaining a loan, the health program, and the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale

loans.name: Ra'nogul

texts.ru: Раъногул одна из немногочисленных уроженцев района Хуросон. Ей 54 года. Она вдова. Раъногул имеет твоих детей. Старший сын работает врачом. Младший уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Раъногул на Родине занимается животноводством. Она работает в этой сфере деятельности около 7 лет. Она любит свой маленький бизнес и много лет хотела увеличить поголовья скотин. Теперь она приняла решение создать устойчивый бизнес с постоянным и высоким доходом. На заемные деньги Раъногул купит несколько голов скотин. Она верит, что ей не откажут в кредите, и она осуществит свой план.
texts.en: Ra'nogul is one of the few natives of the Khuroson region. She is 54 years old and a widow. Ra'nogul has three children. Her elder son works as a doctor. The younger left to work abroad in the Russian Federation. Ra'nogul raises livestock in her homeland. She has been working in this area of activity for about seven years. She loves her small business and for many years would like to increase her livestock count. Now, she has made the decision to create a sustainable business with a regular and high income. With the loan money, Ra'nogul will purchase several head of cattle. She believes that she will not be refused a loan and she will realize her plan.

loans.use: to increase her livestock count.

loans.name: Bikhosiyat

texts.ru:
Бихосияту 63 года. Она проживает в городке Худжанд. Худжанд красивый город, ее называют еще северной столицей. Бихосият вдова, как и любой женщине, ей было тяжело перенести этот период жизни, но она нашла в себе силы жить дальше ради семьи ради детей, ради внуков. Она счастливая мама. У нее один ребенок. Он с женой живет вместе с ними. Также у Бихосият трое внуков. 
  Бихосият дома занимается шитьем «Курпа» и «курпача» уже более 10 лет. Она работает у себя дома, по ее словам удобно сшить на дому. Ей в работе помогает невестка. «Курпа» и «курпача» ватные матрасы. «Курпу» используют в качестве одеяло а «курпача» длинные матрасы используется как диваны. Курпу и курпачу дарят невестам как приданное. Теплое время года наступает и начнется сезон свадеб. Бихосият хочет воспользоваться моментом и увеличить товарооборот. Она на деньги от кредита приобретет ткани, вату, иголки, нитки и другие швейные принадлежности. Она надеется, что Вы ее поддержите, и Бихосият увеличит доход. Бихосият заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en:
Bikhosiyat is 63 years old. She resides in the city of Khujand, a beautiful city which is called the northern capital. Bikhosiyat is a widow. Like any loving wife, she found this period difficult, but she found her strength for the sake of her children and grandchildren. She is a happy mother and she has one child. He and his wife live with her. Bikhosiyat also has three grandchildren.

At home, Bikhosiyat has been involved in sewing "kurpa" and "kurpacha" for more than ten years. She works from home and according to her it is convenient to do so. Her daughter-in-law helps with the work. Kurpa and kurpacha are cotton mattresses. Kurpa are used as blankets and kurpacha are a long mattress used as a sofa. Kurpa and kurpacha are given to brides as a dowry. The warm weather is coming and the wedding season is beginning. Bikhosiyat wants to seize the moment and to increase her inventory. She will use the loan sum to acquire fabrics, wool, needles, thread, and other sewing accessories.

She hopes that she will get support and she will increase her income. Bikhosiyat gives her thanks in advance for the help.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, wool, needles, thread and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура благодарит Вас за поддержку. Она приобрела материал для шитья мешков. Она увеличила товарооборот. Сейчас она шьет не только мешки, но и зимнюю и осеннюю обувь. Она обратилась за повторным кредитом, чтобы купить материалы для шитья обуви и для шитья мешков тоже. Манзура заранее благодарит Вас за помощь и знает, что во второй раз ее снова поддержат.
texts.en: Manzura thanks you for your support. She purchased materials to sew sacks and increased her working capital. Now she sews not just sacks, but also fall and winter footwear. She is looking for another loan so she can buy materials to sew footwear and sacks. She thanks you in advance for your help and knows that she will be supported once more.

loans.use: to buy materials to sew footwear and sacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase combs, a hairdryer, hair products, etc.

loans.name: Bakhtiniso

texts.ru: Бахтинисо 50 летняя жительница не большого района под названием Шахристон, находящийся на северной территории республики. Бахтинтисо замужем за Тойира. У них 20 летний сын. Он учится на врача. Бахтинисо вместе с мужем вот уже 4тый год занимаются животноводством. Бок о бок они работают и трудятся вместе. Они решили обратиться за кредитом, потому, что у них на сегодняшний момент очень малое количество скотов и им необходимо спасти бизнес и увеличить их поголовье. Бахтинисо обратилась за займом, потому что МДО "Хумо" упрощает процессы кредитования для женщин и создает новые и новые кредитные продукты для женщин. Бахтинисо с мужем надеется, что их поддержат на сайте Kiva и они смогут сохранить бизнес и источник дохода. Спасибо!
texts.en:
Bakhtiniso is a 50-year-old resident of the small region called Shahriston, located in the northern part of the country. She is married to a man named Toyir and they have a 20-year-old son who is studying to become a doctor. She and her husband are in their fourth year of working in animal husbandry. They work side by side together. They decided to get a loan since they currently have a small number of livestock and they need to save their business by increasing their herd. 

Bakhtiniso has applied for a loan because Humo simplifies the loan process for women and creates new credit products for women. She and her husband hope that they will find support on the Kiva website and that they will be able to save their business and their source of income. Thank you!

loans.use: to increase their head count of livestock to save their business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and various goods.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 37 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, diapers and other groceries.

In the future Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Famille Bafuruma Group

texts.fr: Lors du partage de leur champ familial par leur père, chacun a reçu une portion où se trouvait des caféiers. Gilbert en a planté d'autres dans sa part car au village c'est un moyen principal de gagner de l'argent. Les travaux champêtre pour lesquels il sollicite ce crédit lui permettront d'accroitre sa production en quantité comme en qualité avec comme finalité l'amélioration de conditions de vie de sa famille. Actuellement, les maladies de plantes et l'absence de débouchés sûrs pour écoulement de sa production constituent un obstacle; toutefois, il compte élargir son champ en éliminant les vieux tiges par des jeunes plants. Il est sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en: When their father shared out the family field, each one received a sector on which coffee bushes were growing. Gilbert planted additional bushes because in his village it is an important source of income. The rural works for which he requests this loan will enable him to increase his production and improve the quality of his production with the ultimate aim of improving his family's living conditions. At the present time plant disease and lack of sure prospects for selling his production, constitute an obstacle; nevertheless, he plans to expand his field by replacing the old stalks by young plants. In the photo he is with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for upkeep, mulching and harvesting.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is very happy, full of energy and grateful to Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders as she is only a step away from meeting one of her goals, that of being a large scale poultry farmer. Jackline, 27, is a smallholder mixed farmer from Nandi Hills, Kenya who is married to a nice husband. They have been blessed with two kids so far. She is very hardworking and focused. Her primary income sources today are milk, eggs, and vegetables, among other crops.

Jackline is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. This expansion seeks to enhance her family's financial security. The more hens she acquires, the more assets under her name and the more income she makes through egg sales. The hens will also bring other numerous benefits including chicks, manure and feathers. The income from this investment will enable Jackline to take better care of her family and pay for her children's education. Lend $25 to improve the quality of life of a wife, a mother, and a progressive lady farmer in Chebarus village.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Lonah; she is 56 years old, married and has 6 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and she learnt skills in enterprise development and financial management. This helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Lonah has been doing dairy farming for the past two years. The business is generating income that has enabled her to provide her family with food and also cater for household expenses. She is taking a Kiva loan so as to buy fodder for her cows to boost production.

Lonah appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the support and help. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fodder that will boost her production and income.

loans.name: Idah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Idah. Idah lives in Sumedang, located about 4-5 hours drive from Jakarta. She is happily married. Idah owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago. She was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business using technology. Idah is a hardworking woman and her community sees her as a trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Idah needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Idah’s goal with respect to Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan.

As seen in the photo, Idah is the one who is standing in front of her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: La Ñusta Iii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA III”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Melitza; La socia tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de internet, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio a socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de una de sus computadoras.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ganadería, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “La Nusta III.”  This bank is located in the district of Calca, belonging to the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                            

The member Melitza is 27 years old and she is single.  She alternates her daily activities with her internet business.  She has been doing this business for a while and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts daily into her business.  She wishes to be able to continue working and in this way move forward.

She is requesting a loan in order to carry out the maintenance of one of her computers.  The other members have businesses selling cattle, food, groceries and animals.

This member thanks those who are part of her dream in this way.  She commits to making her loan payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to carry out the maintenance of one of her computers

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYOPATA-CHONTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Luzmila continua dedicándose al  negocio de agricultura, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio l cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta  forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank Huayopata-Chonta. The bank is located in the district of Huayopata which is part of the province of La Convención in the Cusco department.
Luzmila continues to run her agriculture business. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments on time. She has spent many years working on this business and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into it everyday. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYOPATA-CHONTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua trabajando  en su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia  continua vendiendo  manzanas, naranjas, uvas, plátanos y mandarinas para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the communal bank HUAYOPATA-CHONTA located in the district of Huayopata, province of La Convención and department of Cuzco.

She continues to work at her stall selling fruit: apples, oranges, grapes, bananas and mandarins to all her customers who come to her stall. Francisca is a responsible, hardworking person who wishes to help her family get ahead.

She is seeking a loan to buy oranges and other fruit. She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her monthly repayments.

loans.use: para comprar naranjas entre otros.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Juliana. She is a lovely, self-driven smallholder farmer. She lives in Kapsowar; Kenya.

Juliana has been doing mixed farming for the last decades. On her farm, she grows maize and she also keeps highly productive dairy cows. She considers herself to be more passionate and hardworking than other farmers. She also leaves nothing to chance when carrying out her duties.

She is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to purchase farm equipment. Acquisition of the farm inputs is aligned to her plan of growing her agribusiness to the next level. For the past few years, her biggest challenge has been getting work done with the tools that she has on the farm. They are outdated and worn out, to say the least. As a result, farm work has become strenuous and time consuming. She spends more resources on labour, because working with these tools requires a lot of effort, yet the quality of work keeps deteriorating. 

Juliana is going to use this loan to purchase modern farm equipment that will bring effectiveness and efficiency to her farm work. New improved tools will not only save her on labour costs but will also improve the quality of the work.

With your loan, she will grow her business to greater heights and elevate her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements

loans.name: Alma Dolores

texts.es:
Alma, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta  noveno grado, es madre soltera de una niña de siete años de edad.

Alma, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas desde hace seis meses, el negocio lo inicio debido a que a ella sola le esta tocando crecer a su hija, el horario de elaborar sus tortillas es de 6:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar maíz por mayor y para comprar productos de la canasta básica para colocar una pequeña tienda en su casa, de esa manera lograra mejorar su situación económica y mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Alma es tener un negocio grande con muchos clientes y que no falte lo necesario para que su hija cresca sana y estudie hasta llegar a ser profesional.
texts.en:
21 year old Alma studied through the 9th grade. She is a single mother to a 7 year old little girl.
Alma has had a small business selling tortillas for the past 6 months. She started the business because she is raising her daughter alone. She works making her tortillas every day from 6:00am to 2:00pm.
She will use the loan to buy corn wholesale and to buy staple goods to supply a small store in her house. In this way, she will improve her economic situation and her quality of life. 
Alma's dreams is to have a large business with many customers and to have all that she needs so that her daughter can grow up healthy and study so she can be a professional.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and to buy staple good to supply a small store in her house.

loans.name: Mwanzo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Teresia. She is 38 years old, married and has four children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from courses on enterprise development and financial management which has improved her knowledge in business management. Teresia is able to advance her dairy farming through proper recording and using the profits prudently. She wants to expand her farming by starting fruits farming. She hence needs a Kiva loan to construct a greenhouse. This will lead to more income to cater for family needs. 

Teresia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to pay for greenhouse construction thus boosting farm output.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is a 31 year old mother with four children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printed materials at the market to earn a living. 

Lili has requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine, to assist her in running the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Lili  hopes to build a small elei shop in her village in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tubers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYOPATA-CHONTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Isidora continua trabajando en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Isadora belongs to the communal bank “HUAYOPATA-CHONTA located in the district of Huayopata, province of La Convención and department of Cuzco. She continues to work selling food. She makes different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups, stir-fried meat etc. for her customers. She’s had her business for many years and all is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in every day. This is how she helps her family get ahead.

Isadora is seeking a loan to buy supplies such as oil and rice. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: buy oil, rice etc.

loans.name: Kimyo

texts.en:
Kimyo is a brave woman. She was born into and grew up in a family of agrarians. She was taught to work hard from her childhood. She lives in a village with her family.

She is married and has three children. Her husband is a constructor. They were very poor and that is why, to increase their standard of living and working, they moved from their rural area to a new village. Now she does business in agriculture.

Kimyo is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to renovate her house and buy construction supplies. She needs to make renovations because her house is in bad condition. Dampness and moisture destroys the wall. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for renovating her house

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 25 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents.
 
Jared is presently studying in college, in his fourth year, and at the same time has been running a cell phone loading business for two years already. He is earning an average monthly income of PHP 3,000 in doing this type of business. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional cell phone loads for retail. 

Jared has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jared hopes to expand his loading business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cell phone loads.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 54 years old and is from San Francisco, Baggao. She is married and blessed with four children. Her husband works as a driver, and sometimes they farm corn and rice. Despite earning, they still find it hard to fully support their daughter’s college education.

Their daughter Geraldine is 23 years old and is studying toward a BSc in Biology. She hopes to finish college so she can help her family out of poverty and because she believes that education is the only wealth that her parents can give her.

So to make her daughter’s dreams come true, Felisa wants to avail herself of an education loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: Como propietario de una miscelanea donde vende ofrece variedad de articulos, Carlos hombre casado y padre de un hijo de 1 años de edad, necesita aumentar su liquidéz  y con ello el volumen de sus ventas que impacten positivamente sus utilidades, Pues éste negocio sostiene a su familia, y desea brindarle cada vez mas bienestar. Su idea de negocio surgió atendiendo la necesidad de incrmentar sus ingresos en el año 2012, época en la que inició con poco capital, pero con muchos sueños por cumplir que poco a poco lo han impulsado a lograr ser exitoso, en generar oportunidades de ofrecerle una  educación de calidad a su hijo.  En la miscelanea Carlos vende de contado  y tambien tiene una clientela a la que le otorga créditos, comprando en almacenes de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde encuentre los mejores precios del mercado, para sostenerse con niveles de competencia exigibles en su segmento. Carlos Diariamente trabaja 6 horas, de lunes a domingos, pues su mayor desafio es lograr obtener suficiente capital de trabajo, para comprar en mayor volumen, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, pirmer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancia variada al por mayor y de contado, ropa, accesorios femninos, articulos de higiene personal, cométicos, etc., para cumplir sus sueño de prosperidad, que no es otro que el crecimiento continuo de su negocio, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Carlos is a married man and the father of a 1 year old son. As the proprietor of a general store that sells a variety of products, he needs to increase his liquidity and his volume of sales as these positively impact his profitability. This business supports his family and he wants to offer them greater wellbeing. The idea for his business came out of the need to increase his income in 2012 - a time when he began with little capital but with many dreams to achieve. Little by little, these dreams have inspired him to be successful and to come up with ways to give his son a good upbringing. In the store, Carlos sells for cash and also has customers to whom he offers credit. He buys goods from suppliers in the city of Barranquilla, where he finds the best market prices, so that he can keep up with the competition in this business area. 
Carlos works 6 hours a day from Monday through Sunday. His greatest challenge is having enough business capital to buy wholesale. This is why he came to CrediKiva and requested his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use this loan to buy various goods wholesale and for cash, including clothes, women's accessories, personal hygiene products, cosmetics, etc. He is doing this to fulfill his dream of prosperity, which is to keep growing his business and to successfully use this loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale including clothes, women's accessories, personal hygiene products, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: José Hilario

texts.es:
José, de 26 años de edad, está soltero, no tiene hijos, no estudio y vive con sus padres y sus hermanos tiene otros tres hermanos.

José, trabaja de ayudante de albañil en la zona donde vive y en diferentes tipos de trabajos de donde obtiene sus ingresos económicos.- Anteriormente, trabajo en la construcción de una calle, durante más de una año, de cada pago que recibía cada quince días, poco a poco fue comprando materiales para la construcción de su propio hogar y ahora ya tiene su propia vivienda.- José, se ha crecido en una familia campesina, que le han inculcado muchos trabajos para salir adelante, ha trabajado también en la crianza de especies menores.

José, solicita un crédito para comprar cuatro cerdos valorados en $50.00 cada uno, con los cuales quiere iniciar un nuevo proyecto, ya que en su casa tiene espacio para tener estos animales y generar ingresos económicos, para el desarrollo personal y familiar.- Ademas invertirá $200.00 para comprar lámina, para hacer la galera del corral donde tendrá los cerdos.

José, sueña con ir remodelando su casa poco a poco, hasta hacerla como el quiere, para vivir más cómodo.
texts.en:
José, 26 years old, is single, doesn't have children, isn't in school and lives with his parents and his siblings. He has three siblings. 

José, works as a construction worker in the area where he lives and does different types of work to get his income. In the past, when he worked on the construction of a street, for more than a year, from every payment he received every fifteen days, little by little he was buying materials for the construction of his own home and now he has his own home. Jose grew up in a country family, which taught him many ways to work to get by, he has also worked in the raising of small animals.

José, is asking for a loan to buy four pigs valued at $50.00 each, with which he wants to start a new project, since at his house he has space to have these animals and generate income, for his personal and family development. He will also invest $200.00 to buy sheet metal, to make the galley of the corral where he will keep the pigs. 

José, dreams of remodeling his house bit by bit, until he has made it how he likes, in order to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase four pigs valued at $50.00 each and to buy sheet metal to make the galley of the corral where he will keep the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cell phones, accessories, and telephone cards

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetable oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Lucero De Querarani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCERO DE QUERARANI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante es uno solo, mismo que esta basado en la producción lechera.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luisa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde niña trabaja con este producto, al adquirir un vaca inicia un negocio independiente hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza, realizará la elaboración de sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The loan group Lucero de Querarani will begin their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana. The group is comprised of 8 members and is directed by a board of which Luisa is the President. The members run only one business, which is based on milk production. 
The loan will bring benefits to the micro-entrepreneurs, including Luisa. She tells us that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 2 years and that she joined during a massive promotion that the institution undertook in her area. Currently, she has a business selling milk. She says that she learned this business from her parents and has worked in the dairy business since she was a little girl. She started an independent business several years ago when she bought a cow.
The loan that she is requesting today will be used to increase her capital in order to buy cattle, which she will get from the wholesalers in her community. Once it is grown, she will make her products from the milk. This form of work brings her the resources to economically support her family - she is married and has 5 children.
When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy artisinal soap (gabakourouni)

loans.name: Istat

texts.en: Istat considers herself to be a lucky woman. She was born into a family of agrarians in 1964. After getting married she left her parents house and moved to her husband’s house. She has four children. Unfortunately her husband died. She lives in a village and does her business in this area. She has an activity of trading textiles in the domestic market. It is hard for her to be alone and keep a family. She works in order to have permanent income and feed her family. She is planning to enlarge her commodities by buying new textiles to sell. She is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to buy textiles and increase turnover. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se la ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una venta de accesorios para celular, desde hace 8 años inicio con fondos propios, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada cerca de su lugar de residencia por eso posee muchos clientes, la joven vive con su esposo, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de accesorios para celulares (cargadores, baterías, audífonos, etc.) para tener mas inventario y asi mejores ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
The young person whose face has been blurred is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area.  She sells accessories for cell phones.  This business was started 8 years ago with her own funds.  The business is located in a very busy area near her place of residence and so there are many customers.

This young person lives with her husband.  She is requesting a loan to buy accessories for cell phones (chargers, batteries, headphones etc.) in order to have more inventory and thus have improved economic earnings.

loans.use: to buy accessories for cell phones (chargers, batteries, headphones etc.)

loans.name: Mwanzo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Helenah; a member of Mwanzo Women Group. She is married and has six children. Her economic activity is dairy farming as well as poultry keeping. 

The training from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise development and financial management has enabled her to manage her business well. She needs a loan to buy animal feed to help boost productivity. She hopes that the income level from her business will increase to improve her living standards i.e by paying school fees for her children and affording good clothing and food for them.

Helenah is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and she has promised to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy animal feed that will improve productivity thus providing more income to support family needs.

loans.name: Nancy Njambi

texts.en:
As a married parent with two children, Nancy is 28 years old and is a small scale farmer growing vegetables. She is borrowing a loan to buy more vegetables for planting to add stock to her vegetable farming business.

She hopes that this loan will boost her farming business and will go a long way in helping her to support her family and to meet basic needs.

Nancy is happy for Kiva and the support of its lenders, and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for planting to add stock to her vegetable farming business

loans.name: División San Felipe Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se ubica el grupo División San Felipe se distingue por la gran cantidad de montañas y vegetación que la rodean. 
Rocío o Rosy, como le llaman de cariño en su comunidad, es una mujer sonriente y carismática que no duda en tomar las oportunidades que se le presentan. Ella comenzó trabajando en un puesto de quesadillas y al cabo de dos años, la dueña le ofreció venderle el negocio. Desde entonces, Rosy se levanta a las 4 am para comenzar a preparar diferentes platillos que llevarán las quesadillas que más prefieren sus clientes: pollo con mole, picadillo y chicharrón, entre otros. A las 8 am, ya en el lugar de venta,  coloca sus sillas, su mesa y una pequeña lona para recibir comenzar a recibir a las personas. “Hay días que me va muy bien, pero también hay días no tan buenos” y a pesar de ello, Rosy sigue esforzándose y sintiéndose orgullosa de su pequeño negocio. 
También se siente muy afortunada de poder recibir apoyo para tener el capital necesario y mantener el puesto funcionando. El dinero le ha permitido comprar gas, ingredientes para preparar la comida, jugos, refrescos e incluso platos y sillas para seguir mejorando. 
Día con día Rosy trabaja con la motivación de alcanzar más metas: le gustaría comprar pronto un automóvil para trasladar los alimentos y material hasta el lugar donde coloca su puesto para no tener que caminar o pagar un taxi que al final le podría resultar en mayores gastos. Sin embargo, al hablar de otras razones comenta  “Mi motivación para seguir trabajando es que mi hija quiere ser una gran enfermera, su papá y yo nos esforzamos para apoyarla en sus estudios y pueda lograr sus sueños”. Rosy es una mujer entregada a su negocio, a su esposo y a sus dos hijos.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Leticia quien invertirá en pollos y dulces; Cristina y Valentina, en pollos y pavos; Elvira, Sofia y Ma de la Paz, en ropa; Teresa M., en pavos y dulces, Teresa S., en becerros y Juana, en borregos.

*La fotografia fue tomada en casa de Valentina, Rosy viste una playera blanca*
texts.en:
The community where the División San Felipe group is located stands out for the large number of mountains and vegetation that surrounds it.

Rocío, or Rosy, as the community calls her lovingly, is a smiling and charismatic woman who doesn't hesitate in taking the opportunities that come up. She began working at a quesadilla stand and after two years, the owner offered to sell her the business. Since then, Rosy gets up at 4:00 a.m. to begin to prepare the different foods that the quesadillas will have which are the most popular with her customers, chicken with mole sauce, ground meat and pork rinds, and more. At 8:00 a.m., now in her sales location, she sets out the chairs, her table, and a small awning to begin to welcome the people. "There are days that go very well for me, but also there are days that aren't so good" and despite this, Rosy continues working hard and feeling proud of her small business. 

She also feels very lucky to be able to get help to have the necessary capital and keep her stall running. The money has allowed her to purchase gas, ingredients to make the food, juice, soft drinks, and even plates and chairs to continue improving.

Day by day, Rosy works with the motivation of achieving more goals: she would like to soon purchase a car to carry her food and material to the place where her stall is located so as not to have to walk or to pay for a taxi, which in the end, can be more expensive for her. However, when talking of other reasons, she says, "My motivation to continue working is that my daughter wants to be a great nurse, her father and I work hard to support her in her studies and so she can achieve her dreams." Rosy is a woman who is dedicated to her business, to her husband, and to her two children.

The other members of the group are Leticia who will invest in chickens and sweets, Cristina and Valentina in chickens and turkeys, Elvira, Sofia and Ma de la Paz in clothing, Teresa M. in turkeys and sweets, Teresa S. in young bulls, and Juana in lambs. 

*The photo was taken at Valentina's house. Rosy is wearing a white t-shirt.*

loans.use: to purchase supplies and gas.

location.town: San Felipe del Progreso, Estado de México

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Anna. She is thirty-eight years old, married and a mother of four. All her children are in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does maize and bean farming as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management. This has enabled her in budgeting and record keeping.

She is borrowing from Kiva in order to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds which will increase farm yields and thus increase her profits. This will assist her to cater for the family's needs and in paying school fees. 

Anna is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer that will improve on productivity

loans.name: Niutao

texts.en:
Niutao is a 37-year-old mother with 3 children. She runs a small business of selling tuna sandwiches and toast sandwiches in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Niutao has requested for a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned tuna, plastic bags, a container, butter, and mayonnaise to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Niutao became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her sandwich business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara  por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el posee un taller de reparación de bicicletas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pedales, llantas, cadenas, parches entre otras cosas todo por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The borrower, the young man whose face is blurred in the photo, is 23 and lives in a high risk area. He has for the past eight years run a bicycle repair shop in a high-traffic area near his home. The income from the shop helps the borrower meet the expenses for the household he shares with his family. He is applying for a loan for the wholesale purchase of pedals, tires, chains, patches, and other bicycle supplies so that he can boost his income while continuing to operate the repair shop.

loans.use: for the wholesale purchase of pedals, tires, chains, patches, and other bicycle supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 49 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Araceli is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Araceli has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Araceli would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Menchie is 44 years old and has three children who are in school.

Menchie has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Menchie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rubina is 36 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rubina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rubina requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. Rubina has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rubina would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en: Muhayo is from the northern part of Tajikistan. She was born and grew up in a village. She was educated through secondary school, and after graduation she got married. She has three children, and her husband is a construction worker. In order to improve her standard of living and start a business, she moved from a rural area to a village. To work and earn money, she learned how to sew traditional women's dresses. Muhayo is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to buy construction supplies. She is planning to renovate her house so her family can live in better conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie is a businesswoman from Lazi, Siquijor, in the Philippines. She is 31 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari (variety) store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Lennie is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Lennie continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Crescilia

texts.en:
Crescilia is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Crescilia works in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 10 years, and she has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Crescilia has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her livestock.

In the future, Crescilia would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for raising her livestock

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 51 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresa has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Teresa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a house made from bamboo walls, located in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Noun, supports his family by growing cassava.

Noun is 29 years old and married with three children. He spends his entire time on the cassava field. This is the third loan he has had from VisionFund. As a group leader, Noun spent some of his loan portion on fertilizers. He is reserving the rest of the money to pay for rental fees on farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for rental fees on farmland.

loans.name: Ruela

texts.en:
Ruela is a married woman with seven children. She is 59 years old and five of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ruela has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year. Ruela requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

In the future, Ruela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
A un paso de ser Licenciada en Contaduría y Auditoría, está la joven María José de 22 años. Ella confiesa que dicha carrera la apasionó desde antes de ingresar a la universidad, ya que en todas las empresas es indispensable contar con una persona especializada en esa área, por lo que es una excelente oportunidad para desarrollarse ahí.  	
María José solicita un crédito para el pago del curso de titulación, que le permitirán ser egresada y con lo cual podrá iniciar su vida laboral. Además, ella planea iniciar un negocio en alianza con su mama, lo que le permitirá tener mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María José is 22 years old and is about to finish her studies in Accounting and Auditing. She admits that she developed a great passion for finance before she entered university, knowing that someone with expertise in this field is indispensable to any company. María José recognized that accounting presented her a great opportunity for educational and professional development. 

María José is very close to establishing herself as a professional accountant. She is applying for a loan to pay fees for professional accreditation that will allow her to start her career. María José is planning to go into business with her mother, providing them greater financial stability.

loans.use: to pay fees for professional accreditation.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Monica. She is married and blessed with two children. She does poultry farming and dairy farming.

She is borrowing the Kiva loan so as to buy poultry and dairy feed to improve the animals' production and to facilitate the construction of a better shed for them.

She really appreciates Kiva for the financial intervention so she is able to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy poultry and dairy feed to boost production and be able to construct a better shed for the animals.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Bernard; he is 28 years old. 

Bernard earns a living by farming maize and running a kiosk. He is happy about the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training he received, which equipped him with skills to manage his business. High demand in the market has encouraged Bernard to apply for a loan to boost and expand his kiosk and maize farming businesses. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds and more stocks of foodstuffs for his kiosk business. By improving his supply, he hopes to boost his business and thus be able to meet his family's needs.

Bernard is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as hybrid seed and fertilizer and stocks of foodstuff for his kiosk.
