loans.name: Oigul

texts.en:
Oigul is a strong woman. She was taught to work hard since childhood. She is married and has three children. 

Oigul likes to work in agriculture, and she has ten years of business experience. She has raises, fattens, and sells livestock. Oigul is an honest, kind, and responsible woman. She wants to help her family and tries to support them every time. She and her husband are planning a wedding for their daughter. Oigul needs to work hard to earn money to save for wedding expenditures. That is why she is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to buy cattle and increase her turnover. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Jofelyn

texts.en:
Jofelyn is married and blessed with three children. Two of them are still studying, while the third is engaged in a fish vending business. 

In addition to selling fish, Jofelyn is also a manicurist and a vendor of native cakes within her local community. She and her husband work hard to sustain all their basic needs and support the education of their children.

Jofelyn is requesting a loan of PHP7,000 to buy more kilograms of milk fish, shrimp and tilapia.

loans.use: to buy kilograms of milk fish, shrimp and tilapia to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 57 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 2 adult children. 

Cristina earns a living by trading in rice palay (unmilled rice), rice wholesaling, and providing trucking services. She’s been engaged in this business for 5 years, and she earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month from her business activities, an amount that it is so helpful for meeting her needs. She has requested a loan to purchase additional sacks of rice palay for milling and wholesaling. 

Cristina has been a member of PMPC for almost 5 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her rice palay trading and rice wholesaling business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice palay

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny, age 41, is a carpenter from Siquijor, Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Since joining PMPC, Danny has appreciated the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported him by providing the capital to start his hog-raising business for additional income. He gives his best effort to produce good pigs. 

Danny previously sold one pig at a time. He is now trying to expand his business into swine production. He presented his project proposal to Paglaum MPC for financing, and he has applied for a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase bags of animal feeds. He is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing his capital needs. With his extra income, he wishes to live a happy and comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Thelia

texts.en:
Thelia, a hardworking mother who sells food snacks like puto cheese and rice cakes in the street for money, is very diligent and she works as much as she can. She is a widow from Siquijor.

Thelia has applied her membership with PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. Thelia is in need of additional capital to purchase more raw ingredients to increase her production of puto cheese and rice cakes because she wants to display her food snack in canteens and eateries in the area to generate more income.

She asked for financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 8,000 and is thankful for the financing of her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand her business and to build good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she deeply wishes to provide her family a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients to increase her production of puto cheese and rice cake

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of snack food, canned goods, and other groceries.

Susan has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Susan aspires to save money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of snack food, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 57 years old and widowed with six children. Arsenia works very hard to provide for them.

Arsenia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Arsenia has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, curls (snack food) and other groceries. 

In the future, Arsenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 41 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Marissa has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has been in this business for 22 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 36 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. Melanie works very hard to provide for her family.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 54 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

Rosario has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future Rosario would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 47 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Josie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, spices, soft drinks, and school supplies.

Josie has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Josie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, spices, soft drinks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Ludim

texts.en:
Ludim is 53 years old and widowed with two children. Ludim works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Ludim has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from a bakery.

Ludim aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 44 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell. Teresita has been in this business for 4 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Krishna Group

texts.en:
Krishna JLG was formed in the year 2014 in IRC Village, Bhubaneswar, Khurdha, Odisha, India with 6 active village self-dependent women, with an objective to develop their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of this group have their own businesses. Dali is one of them who has taken a great role for her development and their group members' livelihood improvement. 

The person standing first person from the left, raising her hand in the photo, is Dali. She is about 40 years old and living with her family as she has a husband and three children. 

Dali has been engaged on her own with a dairy activity at her own home in IRC village for 20 years. Through this occupation she earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR. Her opinion is that this income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus for investment in the business so as to materialize her dreams. So to get more income by the expansion of her business, she planned to improve her business in the course of the loan to purchase another two high-breed cows and cow feeding items from the local market, after disbursement of the loan. After completion of the whole process, she hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the construction of a house and to provide better professional education to her children.

The other five members of her group are also smart at their businesses like milk business and tailoring occupations, and hope to boost their livelihoods after loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase two high-breed cows and cow feeding items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her land lease

loans.name: Emitiot Interest Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Vicky, a member of Emitiot Interest Self Help Group. She is twenty seven years old, married and has three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development, savings and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Her economic activity is maize and bean farming and a kiosk business. She needs a loan from Kiva to buy more stocks of flour, salt and sugar for the kiosk business. This will increase sales in the kiosk thus help Vicky enlarge her enterprise. She hopes this will increase her level of income in order to continue supporting her family. Hence, she will be able to improve their living standards with better health care and quality education.

Vicky is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, salt and sugar that will help boost sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, tea leaves, soap, cooking fat and other household items to help meet customers' rising demand

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Yusuf. Yusuf lives in Indramayu, an area in West Java located about four hours’ drive from Jakarta. He is happily married. Together with his wife, he has a very cute son. 

Yusuf owns a stall that sells stationery, mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment service for his community. Yusuf decided to join Ruma because he had already heard that Ruma has the best service and system and he wanted to expand his business with Ruma. Yusuf is a friendly person and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Yusuf needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community. As seen in the photo, Yusuf is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Maria Cesibel

texts.es:
María, de 54 años de edad, no estudio, se creció con sus padres, pero los recursos económicos de su familia no eran suficientes para darles el estudio, trabajo en la crianza de cerdos y en la agricultura desde que era pequeña, se casó cuando tenía 25 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad.

Desde hace 30 años María, se dedica a la venta de pan artesanal, tres días por semana, su madre fue quien le enseño a hacerlo; también tiene una tienda, la cual atiende y administra con su hija. Este negocio lo emprendieron por iniciativa propia, para apoyar a la familia, especialmente a su esposo para generar ingresos económicos y aportar al bienestar familiar.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar harina, levadura, azúcar y huevos para elaborar el pan, también le ayudara para poder invertir en la tienda y surtirla de más mercadería.

El sueño de María, es poder comprar un horno más grande, para poder seguir con su negocio de hacer y vender pan; también sueña con poder arreglar su casa, porque el techo no está en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
María, 54 years old, did not attend school as her parents lacked the funds to pay tuition and fees. Instead of pursuing an education, María began working on her family's farm and caring for their pigs when she was young. María's mother also taught her to bake bread. She married at age 25, started a family, and is the mother of four grown children. 

María has for the past 30 years run a business selling homemade bread three days a week. She also runs a store together with her daughter. María took the initiative to open the store so that she could earn additional income and help her husband provide for their family's well-being. 

María needs this loan for the purchase ingredients for baking bread, such as flour, yeast, sugar and eggs. She'll also use some of the loan funds to invest in the store, purchasing additional merchandise. 

María's goal is to be able to purchase a larger oven so that she can continue baking and selling bread. She also hopes to make renovations to her family's home as the roof is in poor condition.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, sugar and eggs for baking bread.

loans.name: Mangorano Shg Group

texts.en:
Anne is a member of Mangorano self-help group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from training especially enterprise development and financial management. She is 39 years old, married and blessed with four children who are all still in school.

Ann, a vegetable farmer, is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizers and manure to increase her vegetable production in order to meet the high demand of her local customers. She is happy and appreciates Kiva and its lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure to improve  her vegetable production

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en:
Fazilat is a brave woman.  She was born in 1973 and lives in a remote district.  She is married and her husband is in construction.  She has worked for twenty years trading in the domestic market selling socks, warmers and underwear.  Basically, she sells her goods in shops and stores.  Her business is good and she likes her work.  She attracts a lot of clients to her business and her husband supports career.  

She was a participant of training for start-up businesses which was provided by IMON.  Fazilat decided to create an additional business to improve her living and increase her annual income.  She is asking financial support from KIVA lenders to buy calves.  She hopes her new business will be better then trading.  She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 26 years old, married to Evans, and they are blessed with three children aged 8, 6, and 3 years old. She has been farming for the last seven years and earns KES 8,000 per month. 

Esther has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a cow so as to supply more milk to her clients and increase her income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and increase her farm supply.

Her hope is to extend her farming for more income.

loans.use: to buy a cow so as to supply more milk to her clients and increase her income

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is 26 years old, married to Jane and they have no children. He has been a small scale farmer for the last 4 years earning a monthly income of KES 12,500. 

Benedict has applied his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so he can increase the number of litres of milk to sell and to increase his income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his farming activities for more income.

His hope and dream is to provide the basic needs for the family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so he can increase the number of litres of milk to sell

loans.name: Johny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DE COPACABANA.
La socia Johny tiene 39 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño  que le pone cada día  su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, carnes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “Virgen de Copacabana.”

Johny is 39 years old.  She has 4 children and is in a common-law relationship.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business.  She has been in her business for a while and it is going well thanks to all the effort she puts into it every day.  She wishes to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as rice and meat among other items.  She feels grateful for the loan granted and commits to carrying out the payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice and meat among other items

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette works hard to support her family. Nanette is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Nanette has been in this business for 4 years now. 

She requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, can goods, egg, chips, etc.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Nanette would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as soap, milk, can goods, egg, chips, etc.

loans.name: Ludelina

texts.en:
Ludelina is 63 years old, married and has ten children, one of whom is in school.

Ludelina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her live stock.

Ludelina has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ludelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her live stock

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Cecilia is 35 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Ma. Cecilia has a bakery business in the Philippines. Ma. Cecilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, butter, etc. for her bread production business. Ma. Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Ma. Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, butter, etc. for her bread production business.

loans.name: Lira

texts.en:
Lira is 30 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Lira is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Lira has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 28 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Merlita works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home products, and other groceries.

Merlita has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home products, and other groceries

loans.name: Nicky Ann

texts.en:
Nicky Ann is 29 years old and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Nicky Ann has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. Nicky Ann requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Nicky Ann has been in this business for six years. In the future, Nicky Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 46 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Emely works very hard to provide for them.

Emely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, etc.

Emely has been in this business for eight years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Sreytoch's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Ponhea Krek district's Kampong Cham province, Sreytoch is 25 years old, married and the mother of one girl who is not yet old enough for school. 

Sreytoch supports her family's living by selling groceries. Her husband works as a laborer. 

This is Sreytoch's second loan from VisionFund.  She spent the income generated from the first loan to improve the lifestyle of her family. 

Leading a group of two members, Sreytoch requested the second loan to refill the grocery items in her grocery store, hoping to make more money so that she can save up some for her daughter's education.

loans.use: To refill grocery items in her grocery store

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Kitoben Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising hand in the photo is Betty, a member of Kitoben Women Group. She is 37 years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

She does a maize and potatoes business. She has benefited greatly from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to manage her business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer to help boost farming thus increase her income. This will assist her to  cater for family needs such as food and paying school fees for her children. 

Betty is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer that will help boost yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy candles, eggs, Fanta, Sprite, sagiko, milk, sugar, salt, sugar, coffee, cigarettes and biscuits.

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Flomena, a youthful 43-year-old mum, and a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in Koibarak, a remote village in Kapsowar. She is happily married and is blessed with an adorable family.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and has gained significant experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland.

To make ends meet and to make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Kapsowar area is highly populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is, she says: “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is very high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, Flomena feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will be able to sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she gains will be used in fully repaying the loan, changing her living conditions and securing her family's future.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Zhyldyzbu

texts.ru: Жылдызбу 59 лет, вдова, мать 2 детей. У Жылдызбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она работает уборщицей, также занимается животноводством, стартовав 34 года назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: лошадь, 5 коров, 25 овец. Жылдызбу получает пенсию в размере 4,863 сом (KGS), заработная плата - 5,829 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдызбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Жылдызбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zhyldyzbu is 59 years old, widowed, and the mother of two children.  She has a secondary education.  She works as a cleaning lady, and this activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  She is also involved in animal husbandry; she started in this field 34 years ago when she bought her first livestock for 6,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has one horse, five cows and 25 sheep on her farm.  She receives a pension of about 4,863 som (KGS), and makes a salary of 5,829 som (KGS).  Eager to further grow her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy four dairy cows.  This will help her to sell larger volumes of organic milk.  Zhyldyzbu is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy four dairy cows in order to produce and sell larger volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Uon's Group

texts.en:
Uon is 54 years old and married with seven children, two of whom still need her support. Rice farming is the family's main source of income and on average earns her 9 USD a day. Uon's group consist of four female members. 

Uon is the group leader and applied for the loan to get the money to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes the crop yield will be higher than in the previous years and hence allow her to make more income to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Famille Libakale Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LIBAKALE est constitué de 3 membres dont Aimé en est le responsable (l'homme au milieu en chemise  blanche). La culture du café est pratiquée il y a une vingtaine d'années dans sa famille car elle est rentable dans le milieu. Pour lui, l'obstacle majeur se situe dans l'absence de marchés qui peuvent permettre aux caféiculteurs de vendre à un prix raisonnable. Toutefois, Aimé espère accroître ses revenus afin d'assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: The Libakale Group is made up of three members of whom Aimé is the leader (the man in the middle with a white shirt). His family has been growing coffee for some twenty years since it is profitable in the area. For him, the main challenge is the absence of markets which can permit coffee growers to sell at a reasonable price. Nevertheless, Aimé hopes to grow his income so that he can ensure payment of his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay field hands for crop maintenance and harvesting

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose de 48 años de edad   vive en casa propia con su padre, su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo y venta de frutas, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, su padre fue quien le enseño a trabajar en los cultivos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc.  para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 48 years old and lives in his own home with his father, his wife and his 3 children. He earns a living growing and selling fruit. He has over 20 years of experience in this work. His father was the one that taught him to work in growing things. With the earnings he gains he manages to pay some of his household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy manure, fertilisers, pest control, etc. in order to continue working and therefore be able to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбубе 46 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Махбуба с мужем и детьми проживает в годке Турсунзаде. Она занимается шитьем национальной одежды у себя дома и также принимает заказы. Таджикские женщины предпочитают шить одежды на заказ. Махбуба в этой сфере деятельности уже 4 года. Она обратилась за кредитом, потому что она хочет купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить условия работы и ускорить процесс работы. Махбуба накопила денег, но ей не хватает еще $900 на приобретения машинки. Она приняла решение и обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is 46 years old.  She is married and the mother of three children.  She lives with her husband and children in the city of Tursunzoda.  She sews traditional Tajik clothes from home and also takes orders from customers.  Tajik women prefer to sew clothes from orders.

Mahbuba has been working as a seamstress for the past four years.  She is taking a loan because she wants to buy a new, modern, sewing machine in order to improve her working conditions and work faster.  Mahbuba has set some money aside for this purchase, but she still needs $900 (USD) to buy a sewing machine.  For this reason, she has decided to take a loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 60-year-old married woman who has three children.

Rita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Rita has been in this business for 12 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 4 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Rita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Heide is 59 years old and has one child is still in school.

Heide has a rice farm business in the Philippines. Heide requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizer and farm equipment.

Heide has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm equipment

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

Dolly has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Chona works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut grinding business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from retailing soft-drinks. Chona is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy an additional grinder unit for her business.

Chona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional grinder unit for her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and married, and she has five children, four of whom who are currently in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.

Maricel has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and she has borrowed 1 previous loan from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Josefina works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from egg retailing. Josefina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her previous ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marelina

texts.en:
Marelina is 57 years old and married, and she has four children, one of whom is still in school.

Marelina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marelina has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and she has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Marelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 45 years old and married with ten children. With five children presently in school, Jessica works very hard to provide for her family.

Jessica runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns additional income from farming rice. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her shop, like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, coffee, spices, and soft drinks.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 47 years old and married with seven children. With three children currently in school, Lily works very hard to provide for her family.

Lily runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 2 years. Lily has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, and coffee.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Narcisa works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a candle-making business in the Philippines. Marianita has been in this business for 9 years.

Marianita has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials, like wax and cord, for her business.

Marianita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like wax and cord, for her candle-making business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 37-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Alma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her food stall.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Zury Mercedes

texts.es:
Zury es una joven de 22 años que se caracteriza por ser emprendedora y luchadora. Estudia licenciatura farmacéutica y a la vez, vende joyería para ayudarse con los gastos universitarios. El sueño de ser una profesional la llevó a dejar su comarca para estudiar en la ciudad y así poder mejorar su condición de vida. 
El préstamo lo necesita para cancelar los gastos de su título universitario, el cual le servirá comenzar a desarrollarse como profesional. Entre los planes a futuro de Zury esta abrir una farmacia, poco a poco agrandarla, lograr estabilidad económica y formar un hogar.
texts.en:
Zury is 22 years and is entrepreneurial and determined. She study pharmaceuticals and at the same time, she sells jewellery which helps her with her university costs. The dream of becoming a professional made her leave her region in order to study in the city and therefore improve her living conditions. 
She needs the loan to pay for her university fees. This will help her to start to develop herself in order to become a professional. Among Zury's plans for the future, she wants to open a pharmacy and by expanding it little by little, achieve economic stability and start a family.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marietta is 44 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Marietta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marietta requested a 22,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like paint, wood, etc., for the maintenance of her business.

Marietta has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Marietta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like paint, wood, etc., for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old and has seven children. Marissa is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Marissa has been in pig fattening for 9 years now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 10 years. Rosemarie earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Mae Frances

texts.en:
Mae Frances is 38 years old and married with four children, all of which are in school.

Mae Frances is in the agricultural business, raising pigs, in the Philippines. Mae Frances requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccine for her pigs.

Mae Frances has been raising pigs for two years and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Mae Frances would like to earn enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccine for her pigs

loans.name: Sokleng

texts.en:
Sokleng is 35 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school. Sokleng lives in a rural area of Kratie province. Sokleng and her husband have been farming rice to support the family's living for more than 10 years. They also go fishing to supplement their income. 

As she lacks money for the farming business, Sokleng decided to request a loan from VisionFund to get the money to buy fertilizers and rice seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Florencia to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like umbrellas, baby clothes, shoes and socks. 

She is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business, and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy umbrellas, baby clothes, shoes and socks.

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en: Living in a wooden house located in a district of Kampong Cham province, En supports her family's living by farming rice. En is 45 years old and married with six children, five of whom are living with her. To supplement the income, En and her husband also grow tobacco. As she is short of funds, En has formed a group of two members to request loans from VisionFund. She will spend her portion of the loan on fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda is taking a loan of $1500 to improve her business. Her husband is a farmer, and she runs a kiosk to help generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  

Fernanda will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as shoes, hair ties, socks, slippers, and body lotion. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because she hopes to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes, hair ties, socks, slippers, and body lotion to sell

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DE COPACABANA.
La socia  Maritza tiene 33 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño  que le pone cada día  su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, carnes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgen de Copacabana” communal bank. Maritza is 33 years old; she has 2 children and is single. She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. She brings good time with her business, which has gone well thanks to the effort she puts into her business everyday. She wants to be able to continue working because this is how she continues supporting her family.

She requests the loan to buy supplies, such as rice and meat, among other things.

She is thankful for the loan offered, and she promises to comply with the established repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as rice and meat, among other things.

loans.name: Sumilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DE COPACABANA.
La socia  Sumilda tiene 30 años , la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en un restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño  que le pone cada día  su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, carnes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgen de Copacabana” communal bank. Sumilda is 30 years old. She alternates her daily activities by working in a restaurant. She spends a good amount of time with her business, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work everyday. She wants to be able to continue working because in this way, she continues supporting her family.

She requests the loan to buy supplies, such as rice and meat, among other things.

She is thankful for the loan offered, and she promises to comply with the established repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as rice and meat, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income by supplying milk to her customers.

loans.name: Meldy

texts.en:
Meldy is 23 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Meldy has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas. Meldy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marylou is 47 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Marylou has an e-loading station business in the Philippines. Marylou requested a 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy Smart and Globe load to sell to her customers.

Marylou has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy Smart and Globe mobile-phone load to sell to her customers

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Corazon works hard to support her family.  She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from furniture making.  Corazon is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 41 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.  Melba is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Melba requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melba has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Domingga works hard to support her family. Domingga is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net.

Domingga has been in this business for 11 years now.  In the future, Domingga would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Гулчехра жительница маленького городка, гордо носящий имя Турсунзаде. Город был назван в честь великого таджикского современника писателя Мирзо Турсунзаде. 
   Гулчехре 27 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Гулчехра дома занимается древним ремеслом как вышивка. Она вручную вышивает таджикские орнаменты. Гульчехра работает только в таджикском стиле. Она вышивает очень долго, и такая работа является очень кропотливой. Гулчехра планирует создать из одной комнаты себе маленькую мастерскую, в котором будет работать. Так как у нее в доме нет определенного места работы. Она хочет устроить не большой ремонт, перестановку и купить рабочие инструменты. Для всего этого нужны средства и Гулчехра обратилась за кредитом. Она собрала сбережения, но все равно ей не хватает не большой суммы денег, за счет которых она собирается осуществить свой задуманный план.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a resident of the small city proudly named after Tursunzoda, the eminent Tajik poet.  Gulchehra is 27 years old. She is married and a mother.  She is involved in the traditional art of embroidery and she works from home.  She embroiders Tajik decorative items by hand and only works using Tajik techniques.  She embroiders for long periods of time and her work appears very intricate.

Gulchehra is planning to turn one of her rooms at home into a small studio because, at the moment, she doesn't have a particular place to work.  She wants to perform small renovations, reorganize things, and buy some tools.  For all this, she needs money and she has applied for a loan.  She has gathered her savings, but she still needs a small amount of money to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to turn one of her rooms into a studio and to buy tools.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 48 years old, married to Evans, and is blessed with five children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last five years and earns KES 15,000 per month.

Agnes has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk supply for more income that she will use to pay school fees for her children . She plans is to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a Carinderia business in the Philippines. Elizabeth has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional supplies to use in her business like chairs, tables, etc.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies to use in her business like chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Lovelia

texts.en:
Lovelia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lovelia is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lovelia has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to dry and sell in her business.

Lovelia has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Lovelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to dry and sell in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron in large volumes.

loans.name: Arcela

texts.en:
Arcela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cultured pearls business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of cultured pearls to sell for her pearl business.  Arcela has been in this business for 11 years. She earns additional income from fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Arcela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cultured pearls to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 37 years old and has four children. Michelle is married and has four children who are in school.

Michelle is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.  She has been raising livestock for seven years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en:
Mutinda is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives at his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years he has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. 
With the loan that he is requesting of Kes 50,000, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mugala

texts.en:
Mugala is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives at his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of transportation in his business.
With the loan he is requesting he wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married and has one child who is too young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food

For the past two years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbors. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who is too young to attend school . She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Fatuma operates a vegetable stall.  She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has five children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Rose has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Frolbela

texts.en: Frolbela is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as candles ,noodle, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk,water, oils and biscuits.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.  Frolbela  is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy candles, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, oils and biscuits

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and married. She has three children who are eight, seven and six years old respectively.  She has been selling tea leaves for three years. She is taking her second loan to purchase additional stock of tea leaves.
  
She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to open another business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock like  tea leaves  .

loans.name: Leonilina

texts.en:
Leonilina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Leonilila successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Leonilina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking woman and entrepreneur with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, eggs, chips, canned goods, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures. Rosemarie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, eggs, chips, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Melvyn

texts.en:
Melvyn is 57 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Melvyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Melvyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, cereals, milk, beer, and eggs. 

Melvyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman who lives with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. In addition she also operates a firewood selling business

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old and has four children.  She is married and has three children who are currently in school.  Nancy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Nancy has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Edwin Sergio

texts.es: Edwin Sergio, tiene la edad  de 41 años, está casado,  vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de repuestas para hacer la reparación de su vehículo el cual es de suma importancia para hacer el traslado de los materiales utilizados en los trabajos de la finca. Con esta compra espera poder realizar una buena reparación del vehículo y poder tener los materiales a tiempo en la finca y así los cultivos tendrán su asistencia en su momento requerido. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Edwin Sergio is 41 years of age. He’s married and lives with his wife and children, who are his first priority. He intends to purchase spare parts that he uses for his work on the farm with his loan. He hopes to use this purchase to make quality repairs on a vehicle and have farm materials on hand when he needs to so that he has what he needs for the crops at the necessary time. 

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans in state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with greater ease at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair his farm vehicle

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 42 years old and has eight children.  She is married and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Lucila has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Lucila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine lives in the town of Vanadzor with her mother and two kids. She is a nurse by profession, working on an ambulance in the local town. In addition to her work as a nurse, Qristine started a clothing sales business last year. All of her earnings go toward her kids’ expenses, utility expenses, food expenses, and other costs necessary to provide the minimum living conditions for the family.

Qristine has now applied for a loan to enlarge her clothing sales business. She plans to purchase new stocks of clothing to sell to her customers. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for new stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Malonga

texts.en:
Malonga, a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school, lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Malonga has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables including wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces the challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business.

With this loan, Malonga wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with six children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. They are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Luvuno dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and bean. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mariam operates a vegetable stall at the market, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation, but dreams of expanding her enterprise and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With this loan, Mariam wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy biscuits,salt and noodles

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 46 years old. He is married and has six children between 19 and 7 years respectively,  whom he supports. 

He runs a green grocer stall which has lasted for five years now.  He is taking a second loan with VisionFund Kenya which he  will be using to purchase stock like tomatoes, sukuma wiki, potatoes, cabbages and carrots.

His hopes and dreams are to expand the business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase stock like tomatoes, sukuma wiki, potatoes, cabbages and carrots.

loans.name: Perlitas De El Plan Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLITAS DE EL PLAN” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mayde es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de productos por catálogo, tienda de barrio, venta de productos de telefonía, venta de edredones y frazadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mayde es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de lencería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que hace varios años apoya a su tía quien tiene el mismo negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lencería por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución y le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Perlitas de el Pan” begins its first cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Focal Center. The group is composed of nine members and is headed by the board of which Mayde is the Secretary. Businesses that the members of the community bank carry forth are varied. Among them are selling clothing, selling products by catalog, a neighborhood store, selling telephone products, and selling quilts and blankets. 

This loan is an important benefit for a small entrepreneur like Mayde. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago entering on the invitation from a massive promotion the organization carried out in her area last year. Today she has a business selling lingerie. She learned this business from her mother. She had supported her aunt in the same business for several years. With the passage of time, she decided to start an independent business. 

The loan she is requesting is for a capital increase to buy lingerie wholesale from a wholesaler in the city of La Paz. She will sell them in her retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially since she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training offered by the institution and would like to share it with her peers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale lingerie

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her income from supplying milk to her clients.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 22 years old, and is blessed with two children, four and one year, respectively. She has been farming for the last eight years and earns KES 8,000 per month.

Christine has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the amount of milk supplied to her clients. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to expand her farming activities in the area.

Her hopes is to expand her farming for more income and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so that it increases the amount of milk supplied to her clients.

loans.name: Amelina

texts.en:
Amelina is married and she works hard to support her family.  She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-loading.  Amelina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Amelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nolly

texts.en:
Nolly is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets and feed for her business.

Nolly has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 33 years old and has four children who are in school.

Mary Ann has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of dried fish to sell .

Mary Ann has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additioanal stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie, a 38-year-old married mother of eight, works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a general store in the Philippines for six years.

A recipient of previous funds through Kiva, Debbie has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roberth

texts.es: Roberth, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra del cultivo de café y así que tenga una buena desarrollo, y de un almácigo con un buen desarrollo y sanidad adecuada, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Roberth, 44, is married and lives with his wife and children, who are his highest priority. He intends to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other products to apply when he plants his coffee crops so that they can develop well. He will also get a nursery for good development and adequate sanitation plus he will pay labor to help apply the inputs, assist in planting, and ensure a job well done. He aims to take advantage of good weather and soil conditions in his growing area and his several years of experience in growing coffee. 

He will be able to buy the best products of the best quality for his plants to have good development and health as well as an adequate harvest with significant short-term production. With his earnings from his expected harvest he wants invest in the wellbeing and education of his family to reach some family goals and continue investing in his crops. 

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other loans in state banks but FUDESCOR has provided a loan with greater ease and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to grow coffee

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: A villager from Prey Prorsorb district's Kratie province, Kim, supports her family's living by running a small grocery store. Kim is a widowed mother of four children, three of whom are in school. As a single mother, Kim is struggling to support her children's schooling. To increase her income, Kim requested a loan from VisionFund to get more grocery items to sell. She hopes to continue supporting her children in school until graduating.

loans.use: To get more grocery items for her grocery store

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en:
Since 2006, Imaculda has operated a second-hand business where many people come to buy every day. She has requested a $1200 loan to buy additional supplies such as shorts, long pants, and long and short sleeve shirts.
 
Running a business has allowed Imaculada to be independent, responsible for both herself and her family. She hopes to run a bigger enterprise in the future.

loans.use: To buy shorts, long pants, and long and short sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah lives Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children and all are in school. She lives in her own house, and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family . She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for over 13 years and works six days a week. Her main business challenges include seasonality of food. She also generates additional income through tailoring. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of sweet potatoes, bunches of green bananas and Irish potatoes. Her goal is to start farming and buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy bags of sweet potatoes, bunches of green bananas and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose she is 37 years old and married. She has four children whom she supports. Rose has been selling second-hand clothes for one year now. 

She is taking her first loan to purchase stock like t-shirts, trousers, shorts and second-hand baby clothes .

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business .Her hopes and dreams are to open another business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock  like t-shirts, trousers, shorts and second-hand baby clothes .

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.  She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures. 

Michelle dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she cN afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anavilla

texts.en:
