Anavilla, a married 36-year-old  mother of three children, two of whom are in school, is a very hard working entrepreneur. For the past year she has had  a food vending business in the Philippines.

Anavilla has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her enterprise. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 29 years old. She is single with no children. She has run a mobile money transfer business for the last four years. Her monthly income is 28,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to increase her float in the business so that she will be able to meet the demands of her customers. She plans to use the profits to educate her sister. 

In the future, she wants to open other mobile money transfer shops and have a stable family.

loans.use: To increase the float in her mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en:
Teodola is 49 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Teodola is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teodola has been farming vegetables for ten years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leddie

texts.en:
Leddie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leddie is 26 years old and has one child, who is in school.

Leddie has a retail home care products business in the Philippines. Leddie requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soap.

Leddie has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is managing her food vending business in Lazi, Siquijor, Philippines. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. They have been doing well supporting the needs of the family. Concepcion has local customers and also accepts orders for additional income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to be able to open a small eatery.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 38, she is married and the family lives in Larena. She runs a store that primarily supports their family. Every day she never gets tired of tending her store. Mercy is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without defaulting. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventories will mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analyn is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Analyn has a buy and sell of coconut shells business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy coconut shells to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells to sell

loans.name: Buena Suerte 2 Group

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 6, 10 y 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de zapatos de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, buena oyente, de buena actitud, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona sur de la ciudad; caracterizada por las carreteras que conectan a la ciudad y por encontrarse 1 aeropuerto internacional, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 19-35 grados centígrados.
Claudia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa suelto, ojos pardos, complexión física mediana, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y hala español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (de pie al centro, viste blusa rosa y pantalón azul). Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia de la familia, que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. su preocupación por mejorar sus ingresos para pagar los gastos de sus hijos la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de bisutería, tienda de barrio, venta de sábanas, venta de comida, reparación de teléfonos celulares, mototaxi y ferretería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de zapatos de segunda mano, su mercadería procede mayormente del mercado Europeo; Limpia con ligeras imperfecciones y diseños menos comunes que los del mercado propio, de varias calidades; de primera, segunda calidad y tercera. Llegan empaquetados en sacos de 25, 30 y 40 kilogramos y clasificados por género y estación temporal (hombres, mujeres, niños. Selección por verano e invierno). De forma ambulante ayudada con un carrito de 2 ruedas ella se ocupa de visitar las diferentes ferias y mercados de la ciudad. “vendo toda la mercadería, la gente los busca por el precio y por los materiales y diseños…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la venta de zapatos de temporada de segunda mano, la desventaja es contar con poca mercadería. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de zapatos, ella desea realizar la compra de zapatos por paquete de 40 kg, para ofertar mayor cantidad y generar mejores ingresos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para la compra de 1 paquete de zapatos de segunda  mano para ofertar mayor cantidad y pagar los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en: Claudia is a 31 year old woman, single with 3 children ages 6, 10 and 13 years old. Her business is to sell used shoes. She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, a good listener, with a good attitude, responsible and hard working. She sells on the street in the southern part of the city, which is characterized for its highways connected to the city, with an international airport and a tropical, warm climate, with a temperature which fluctuates between 19-35 degrees Celsius. Claudia is dark complected, with long, loose black hair, dark eyes, medium built, and short stature. Her native tongue is Guarani, which she speaks at home, and she also speaks Spanish as general knowledge and for her business.  (in the picture, she is standing up in the center, she is wearing a rose colored blouse and blue pants.) She shares her life with her children who are studying in school. They own their own house which has running water, electricity, and sewage. Her concern, to be able to have enough income to pay for her children's expenses, drove her to create a group of people with businesses such as jewelry sales, a neighborhood store, linens sales, food sales, cellular phone sales, motorized taxis and a hardware store;  to apply for a loan and improve their activities. Her business is to sell second hand shoes.  Her merchandise comes primarily from the European market. Clean, with slight imperfections and more original designs than the local ones, they come in a variety of qualities (first, second and third quality.) They arrive packaged in sacks of 25, 30, and 40 kgs. and are classified by gender and season (men, women, children, selected by summer and winter.) On the street, with the help of a two wheel cart, she visits the diverse fairs and markets in the city. "I sell all the merchandise, people look for them and like them because of the price and the materials and designs...) she states. The advantage of this business is the sale of seasonal second hand shoes, the disadvantage is that she has a low inventory. Her dream is to open a shoe store, she wants to buy a lot of shoes of 40 kgs. in order to get a greater quantity and to generate better earnings. This is the second loan with the institution in one year of having her business independently. Claudia is asking for a loan to buy one lot of used shoes to sell a greater quantity and cover her children's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a lot of used shoes to sell a greater quantity and pay their children's expenses.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 35 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Divina works very hard to provide for them.

Divina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, like coffee, cigarettes, home care products and groceries.

Divina has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like coffee, cigarettes, home care products and groceries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear products. Elizabeth is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store.

Evalyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Evalyn's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida works hard to support her family. Loida is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts  for the maintenance of her vehicle.

Loida has been in this business for one year now.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Kratie district of Kratie province, Chanthy is 46 years old and the mother of a child. She earns income to support her family’s living via growing rice and planting vegetables. This is her fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as she has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fuel and fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to get a better yield to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fuel and fertilizer to support her business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 52 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elizabeth has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from general store. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 43 years old and married with one child. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as bath soap, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, bread, etc.

Judith requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bath soap, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, bread, etc. to sell.

Judith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bath soap, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Nelma works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nelma is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Nelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Erick Anthony

texts.es: Erick Anthony, tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltero, vive con sus madre y hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de equipo y herramientas para trabajar en ebanistería en madera para hacer muebles, la cual le facilitará la preparacion de madera y así poder aumentar la cantidad de muebles realizados y aprovechar el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones y poder tener ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de madera y otras productos, y  también lograr un mejor acabado a los muebles fabricados, además de aumentar la cantidad y calidad de piezas. Con esta compra pretende hacer más nubles y con diseños más variados y así cumplir con los pedidos a corto plazo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Erick Anthony is 20 years old, he is single,  and he lives with his mother and brothers. They are his priority. With this loan, he is trying to buy equipment and tools to work in cabinetry and woodworking to make furniture. He will buy wood, and this will allow him to increase the quantity of furniture made and to apply the knowledge acquired through workshops and be able to have enough income to continue investing in wood and other products. He also wants to give a better finish to the furniture made, besides increasing the quantity and quality of these pieces. With this purchase,  he will make more pieces with diverse designs and be able to meet his orders in a short period of time. This is the first loan received from FUDECOSUR.  He did not have other prior loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR gave him this loan with better terms and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy tools for cabinetry work.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 52 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Sarah has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell.

Sarah has been in this business for two years. In the future, Sarah would like to save money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a woman who is 50 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Natividad has a copra-making business in the Philippines. Natividad requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional coconut to use in her business.

Natividad has been in this business for four years. In the future, Natividad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts to use in her business

loans.name: Las Mariposas De 16 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MARIPOSAS DE 16 DE AGOSTO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Matilde es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, compra de busos, venta de polainas, venta de mantas, taller de costura, venta de cerveza. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Matilde es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de gaseosas artesanales; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años aprendiendo la elaboración de su hija, quien trabajaba con este producto anteriormente, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementa un negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra azúcar, gelatina y durazno seco por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene seis hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad de la obtención del crédito, el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “LAS MARIPOSAS DE 16 DE AGOSTO” [The Butterflies of August 16th] will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional hub. It is composed of eight members and is run by a governing board where Matilde is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and among them are: transportation service, sweatshirt purchase, legging sales, blanket sales, a sewing shop, and beer sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit the small microenterprises of which Matilde is a member. She joined Pro Mujer eight years ago, joining by the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business making craft sodas. She started this business several years ago, learning the production from her daughter who was working with this product before. As time passed she decided to implement an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to expand capital (buy wholesale sugar, gelatin, and dried peach) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers of the city of El Alto and afterwards produce it. She will sell it in her selling space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she lives in cohabitation and has six children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the ease of obtaining loans, the health area, and the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sugar, gelatin, and dried peach.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and stock of napier grass feeds for the dairy cows in order to increase milk production

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with eight children, three of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She lives in her own house with no access to electricity or piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food. She sells yellow bananas wholesale at the market. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for the last 15 years. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of yellow bananas. Her major challenge includes transportation, which hinders movement hence increasing operational costs. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bunches of yellow bananas.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is single with one child. She sells used clothes at the market and has been in this business for two years. She works at the market seven days a week on a retail basis. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include water and power charges. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care and being friendly. Her major business challenges include seasonality of clothes at the market.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like coffee, sugar, eggs, canned goods, soap, shampoo, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling charcoal.

Rosemarie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like coffee, sugar, eggs, canned goods, soap, and shampoo

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 40 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Letecia has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Letecia has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell native bags business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy more native bags to resell.

Connie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Connie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more native bags to sell

loans.name: Norbeta

texts.en:
Norbeta is 61 years old and married with five children. Norbeta works very hard to provide for them.

Norbeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, seasonings, soft drinks, noodles, candies, etc. to sell.

Norbeta has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, sugar, seasonings, soft drinks, noodles, candies, etc. 

In the future, Norbeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, sugar, seasonings, soft drinks, noodles, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, cigarettes, noodles, water, biscuits and slippers

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock such as water, sugar, salt, milks, eggs and cigarettes to keep in her store. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300. Joanina is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy water, sugar, salt, milks, eggs and cigarettes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man who has been working in the construction business for six years and specializes in cement work. He is a hard worker, with special talents in his domain. He is well known in his region and has a good reputation.

Ali is working hard to handle more than one project at a time, but the lack of tools and wood in addition to necessary construction needs keeps him limited with no step forward. 

Thus, for this reason, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary wood and update his business tools to facilitate his business and improve his work.

His dream is to open a paints selling shop, and he hopes that he can make his dream come true soon.

loans.use: To buy necessary wood and update his business tools to facilitate his business and improve his work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase the primary substance for incense

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as salt, onions, and tomato paste

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina de 54 años de edad es viuda y vive en casa propia con sus tres nietas, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos de hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, pesticidas, etc. y así poder tener mejores cosechas para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristina is 54 years old,  a widow,  and lives in her own home with her three granddaughters. She farms basic staples, and has been engaged in this work for 20 years. She sells her crops in the neighboring villages, and with the earning she gets, manages to cover her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, herbicide, seeds, pesticides, etc., so that she can have better harvests and an improved quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, herbicide, seeds, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a hog raiser within her local community. She has been running this business for five years. She aims to have continuous smooth flow of her business, that's why she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use this loan to buy stock of hog feed, vitamins and vaccine for her hogs. Susan is 48 years old, married to a fisherman and has five children. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted, to keep her business profitable.

loans.use: to buy stock of hog feed, vitamins and vaccine needed for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is forty years old. He is a married with two children. He runs an agro-vet business. He has been in the business for five years. His monthly income is KES 20,000.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase stock of fertilizer, seedlings, and farm chemicals to sell to his customers who are mostly farmers.

He plans to use the profits to educate their children. In the future, he hopes to become a distributor of farm chemicals.

loans.use: To purchase stock of fertilizer, agro-chemicals, and seedlings to sell to his customers who are mostly farmers.

loans.name: Anzurat

texts.en:
Anzurat is a cheerful and attentive woman. She was born in 1973 and has one child. Her husband has died. She is disabled for work, but she needs to feed her family. 

She has ten years practice in trading dry fruits. She dries fruit at home and sells it in the domestic market. Also she processes parched corn. She is planning to process corn and needs financial support from KIVA lenders. She hopes she will process corn this season.

loans.use: To process corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to boost amount of milk suppplied to his clients for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase the amount of milk supply to her clients for more income.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a widowed woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Pacita is 64 years old now.

Pacita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Pacita requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Pacita has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Pacita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a making and selling native bags business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her bag making business.

Amalia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Amalia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her bag making business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and married with two children who are in school. Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

Lydia has been in this business for eight years.

In the future Lydia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Nenita has a general store business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like sugar, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Saturnina works hard to support her family.

She has a abaca-weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell home product care.  Saturnina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy abaca fiber to use in her business.

Saturnina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber to use in her business

loans.name: Lavella

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lavella works hard to support her family.

She has a broom making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.  Lavella is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more materials like bamboo, wire, rope, etc., for her broom making business.

Lavella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like bamboo, wire, rope, etc., for her broom making business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 61 years old and married with 8 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Alma has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buy and sell dried coconut meat.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Emerlyn requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Emerlyn has been pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed 45 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emerlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Ludgina

texts.en:
Ludgina is 53 years old, married, and has three children.

Ludgina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ludgina has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns additional income from selling sand and gravel and pig fattening.

Ludgina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 45 years old, married, and has four children.

She earns a living by farming citrus in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional variety of citrus plants and fertilizers.

Gloria has been farming citrus for seven years and also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional variety of citrus plants and fertilizers

loans.name: Ermida

texts.en:
Ermida is 62 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ermida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Ermida has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
Inda is 52 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Inda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Inda has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, and groceries

loans.name: Ruthena

texts.en:
Ruthena is 62 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Ruthena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her ducks.

Ruthena has been raising ducks for five years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her ducks

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a constructor and this is his second loan. He continues providing construction service in Vanadzor town. Artur received his first loan from SEF in 2013, and since then he has been a diligent client of SEF. The first loan helped him to purchase tools and equipment needed for his work.  Artur says "SEF  enabled me to work, live and support my family in my home country. I am so grateful to SEF for believing in me."

After successfully paying back his first loan, Artur has requested a second one to purchase parquet (70 sq. m) needed as a material for his construction work. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Artur hopes for lenders' support one more time.

loans.use: to pay for parquet (70 sq. m)

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is involved in installation and strengthening of the car signal system. He has three years of working experience. Davit lives and works in Vanadzor town with his parents. He needs more funds for the development of his business. Davit has applied for this loan to purchase a new type of car signal system for installation. 
He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a new type of car signal system for installation

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en: Chenda lives in Thmor Koul district's Battambang province. She is a widowed mother of two children. As a single mother, Chenda supports her family's living by growing vegetables to sell. She earns around 12 USD a day on average. As she wants to improve the living standard of her family and earn more income for her kids' schooling, Chenda led a group of two members to request loans from VisionFund. She spent her loan portion on fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her vegetable plantation

loans.name: Yong's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Thmor Koul district's Battambang province, Yong supports her family's living by planting vegetables. Yong has two children, one of whom is under school age while the older one works for labor. 

The business does not make good profit. It is just enough to support daily expenses. As the current house is getting old, Yong led a group of three members to apply for the loans. She will use her entire loan portion to build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: To build a decent house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Kisima

texts.en:
Kisisma is 46 years old and married. She has four children aged 12, 8, 6, and 4 years whom she supports. She is a charcoal vendor and she has been  in this business for twelve years now. 

She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya to purchase an additional stock of charcoal. She will use the anticipated  profit to expand her business. 

Her hopes and dreams for her business and children are to open another business  and  educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of charcoal

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 37 years old, married to Rudiah and blessed with five children. He has been operating as a fruits and vegetable seller for the last four years and earns KES 8,000 per month.

Albert has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to increase his income from the supply of milk. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his supplies in the market.

His future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old. He is married and blessed with two children who are two years old and 7 months old.

Joseph operates a transport business via his motorbike, which he has done for two years now.

He has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will be using to repair and maintain his motorbike. He hopes that the income generated will help him to purchase another motorbike. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorbike

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 25 years old and single. For the last two years, she has been operating a retail shop. She is taking her first loan to purchase stock like sugar, tea leaves, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, toothpaste and eggs.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hope and dream for her business is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock like sugar, tea leaves, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, toothpaste and eggs.

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en:
Andresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell live fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase boxes of live fish to sell.

Andresita has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of live fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry for her farm

loans.name: Amorlina

texts.en:
Amorlina is 44 years old and married with six children.  With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Amorlina has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 40 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business poultry in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other poultry supplies.

Edna has been poultry for three years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other poultry supplies

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of linen and other materials for her business.

Elvira has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of linen and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mary Lie

texts.en:
Mary Lie is 42 years old and has six children.  She is married and has five children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Lie has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eah Mae

texts.en:
Eah Mae works hard to support her family. Eah Mae is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Eah Mae requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Eah Mae has been in this business for three years now.

Eah Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is a taxi driver from Yerevan. He lives and works there with his wife and 13-year-old son. Samvel drives a taxi using his own car. His tireless and hard work brought Samvel success and he was able to purchase a new car. He plans to continue taxi driving with the new car and use his current car as a rental. This will enable him to have an additional source of income.  Samvel asks for this loan to be able to pay for custom clearance for his new car and installation of a fuel system in it. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for custom clearance for his car and installation of a fuel system in it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various kinds of goods for his small grocery to expand his business

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
José, de 30 años de edad, es obrero, no estudio porque sus padres no tenian recursos economicos porque eran personas muy pobres y solo alcanzaban para la alimentación diaria; está acompañado y tiene un hijo, el cual se encuentra estudiando, su pareja trabaja en la platanera de la comunidad.

José, trabaja en los regadillos de la comunidad desde hace 15 años, para llegar a su trabajo tiene que viajar en bicicleta 1 kilómetro y su horario es de 5:00 a.m. a 10:00 a.m. también trabaja 24 horas de bombeador, en los tiempos de descanso, se dedica a la corta de caña.

El crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar una motocicleta, para no viajar más en bicicleta, porque es más peligroso.

El sueño de José, es poder comprar una vivienda de ladrillo para su familia.
texts.en:
José, who is 30 years old, is a laborer. He did not go to school because his parents didn't have the financial resources because they were very poor and could only manage to feed him. José is married and has one sone who is studying. His wife is working in the local banana plantation.

For the past fifteen years, José has worked in the irrigated fields of the community. To get to his job he has to travel 1 kilometer by bike, and he works from 5 a.m. to 10 a.m. He also works 24-hour shifts as a plumber. During his breaks, he works cutting cane.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle so that he does not have to continue traveling by bicycle, because it is very dangerous.

José's dream is to purchase a home, made of brick, for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
Maria es madre de 13 hijos entre los 28y 53 años y vive en unión libre. 

Aparte de su familia, se ha dedicado a la agricultara durante toda su vida. 
Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. 

Ella y su familia viven en zona rural de Cocorna en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que ofrece la Corporación Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos de plátano.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Maria sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra y así tener en pleno el control de sus tierras.
 
¡Impacte la vida de Maria y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
María is the mother of 13 children who are between 28 and 53 years old. She lives in a domestic partnership.

Aside from raising her family, María has worked in agriculture all her life. She learned this business empirically, that is to say, she learned it through the work and by observing other people. 

María and her family live in the rural area of Cocorna, where it is not easy to get access to financial services like those offered by Corporación Interactuar.

She plans to use her loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, pest control and fertilizers to maintain and sustain her plantain crop.

Thanks to this loan, the finances and quality of life for María's family will get better because she will be able to increase her income.

María dreams of finishing the process of legalizing her property rights and of having full control over her land.

Help make an impact on the lives of María and her family by making a loan!

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of attending Spire Education's six-week career accelerator programme.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salon equipment and meet her customers' demand and to buy second hand clothes to sell door to door.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en: Hanadi is a 19-year-old married lady who has been working as a tutor from her house for three years, to support her beloved husband in improving their living and at the same time expanding knowledge in her region. Hanadi is working hard to develop her family's living, especially because they have to make sure that when they have children, they must provide them with the necessary living needs and the best education. That's why she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to start her own clothes-selling business from her house as a first step forward, in addition to supporting her beloved husband in buying a good quantity of iron pillars to develop and expand his work. Hanadi's dream is to open a clothes selling shop in the future, which she will work hard to achieve soon.

loans.use: To start her own clothes-selling business from her house, in addition to supporting her beloved husband in buying a good quantity of iron pillars to develop and expand his work

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling native bags. Roberta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell for her general store business.

Roberta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Moses's Group

texts.en:
Moses is a 40-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 8 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Moses has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Moses described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Moses’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Heydi Raquel

texts.es:
Heydi, de 35 años de edad, hasta cuarto grado, se creció con sus padres, es madre soltera de 4 hijos.

Heydi, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de especies menores como cerdos y aves de corral; también trabaja en la agricultura, sembrando maíz y frijol, estos trabajos los aprendió gracias a sus padres, para poder llevar ingresos económicos a su hogar.

Heydi, está solicitando un crédito para comprar 4 cerdos y comprar concentrado para engordarlos y luego venderlos en la comunidad y así poder generar mayores ingresos económicos para su familia.

El sueño de Heydi,  es cambiar el piso porque actualmente es de tierra y le causa problemas respiratorios debido al polvo cuando se barre.- Además, desea seguir apoyando a su hijo en los estudios, para que pueda superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Heydi is 35 years old. She studied through the fourth grade and grew up with her parents. Heydi has four children and is a single mother.

She is a homemaker and also raises small animals such as pigs and birds. She also works in agriculture, growing corn and beans. She learned these trades thanks to her parents, and they help her earn an income for her family.

Heydi is requesting a loan to purchase four pigs and to purchase feed to fatten them up. She will then sell them in the community, which will enable her to earn a greater income for her family.

Her dream is to get a new floor, because her floor is made of dirt and it causes respiratory problems because of all the dust it creates. She also wants to continue supporting her son in his studies, so that he is able to get ahead academically.

loans.use: to purchase pis and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase the amount of milk supply for more income.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther's Group is formed by 5 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Esther, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 26 years old, married and has 4 children. Esther has been a farmer for 8 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Esther isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Esther will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during the dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Esther's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 2 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve their harvests of maize.

loans.name: Kata's Group

texts.en:
Kata, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills. He is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Kata will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of his loan means that now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Kata plans to use the profits he gains this year to save more money for the future.

In total, Kata’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Rosene

texts.en:
Rosene is 30 years old and a married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Rosene has a buy and sell of fertilizer business in the Philippines. Rosene requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of fertilizer to resell.

Rosene has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosene would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fertilizers to resell.

loans.name: Toeurn's Group

texts.en: Toeurn, 46, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province and she is a mother of four children. Three of her children are dependent on her. To support her family, she grows rice and works for others for a labor fee. The current business earns her family about 38,900 KHR per day. This is her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. In this group of three members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia owns a variety store. She is a widow and has two children. She is engaged in a hog raising business. Ofelia is an industrious and hardworking woman. She aims to increase her stock of merchandise but she doesn't have enough capital to do so. With regards to this matter, she is seeking a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use this amount to buy stocks of merchandise such as noodles, assorted biscuits, canned goods, ingredients and eggs to sell. Ofelia hopes for the smooth flow of her variety store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her variety store

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a 30-year-old man from the town of Kakamega, in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Hellen, who is a businesswoman and helps to support the family. Cyrus supports seven people in the family and has one child who is one-and-a-half years old.

Cyrus operates a motorcycle transportation business within his local town. He has been operating this kind of business for the past eight years and comfortably makes a monthly income of 28,000 KES. 

He is taking his second first loan VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to repair his motorbike and buy spare parts. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business by purchasing another motorbike for transportation.

His dream is to have a stable business and support his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 45 years old with four children. With one child in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for her family.

Alicia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like soap and groceries.

Alicia has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store, like soap and groceries.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 67-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing her group of ten farmers in Webuye District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Mary has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Mary described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, besides fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy more land to cultivate.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of a four-year-old child, and she is from Ormoc City, Leyte. She earns a living through her sari-sari, or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Analyn has been in the business for more than four years now. 

Analyn is asking for a loan to buy more good to sell at her store, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments. She believes that a loan will help her improve her inventory, thus attracting more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Analyn dreams of making her store more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her child’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more good to sell at her store, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling goat meat to the community. The major business challenges she faces are seasonality and transportation.

With this loan, Mjeni plans to buy more goats to slaughter and sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy goats to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 30 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children who are in school or still infants. Leonor earns a living from her "pancit" noodle business. She's been in the business for eight years already. She earns approximately 30,000 PHP each month from this type of business.

Leonor has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. She requested a loan to buy main ingredients like flour, salt, oil and seasonings for her "pancit" business. In the future, Leonor hopes to become a major supplier of "pancit" in her town and to other nearby cities and provinces.

loans.use: to buy main ingredients like flour, salt, oil and seasonings for her "pancit" business.

loans.name: Kimlang

texts.en:
Kimlang, village chief of Chhnok Tru village, is a farmer and also a fisherman. He loves working, even though he has almost reached the age of retirement. Even though all his children are independent, he never stops working to keep himself from becoming a lazy man. 

He wants to buy solar energy system to save money and have security. Therefore, he is applying for a loan through Kiva to buy a reliable solar energy system for his home. With a solar energy system, he would not be concerned about security at night and safety in the house.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar energy system.

location.town: Chhnok Tru Village,Chhnok Tru Commune, Boribo Dist

loans.name: Sameu's Group

texts.en: Sameu is 47 years old and married with four children, three of whom are under her support. The family lives in the Battambang province. Sameu supports her family's living by running a grocery store. This is Sameu's second loan with VisionFund. She requested the loan to get more grocery items for her grocery store since she hopes to increase her profits to better support her family and also her children's education.

loans.use: to get more grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Zebi

texts.en:
Zebi is a baker, and cooks tasty traditional bread. She is from the northern part of Tajikistan and lives in a village. She is a widow and has three children.

Zebi has about eight years of experience baking bread at home. She bakes one sack of flour a day, and her customers are local people. She wants to bake even more delicious traditional bread and plans to buy a dairy cow to bake bread with milk. The bread baked with milk is in more demand and tastes  better. 

Zebi is planning to buy dairy cow and asks for financial support from Kiva lenders. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 47 years old, and she is married with six children. The family lives in Larena, Siquijor. Marlyn and her husband earn a living by farming. They mastered this type of activity when they got married, and it supported their children's education and their family's needs. 

Marlyn joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in February, 2012. She is a hardworking mother who has a strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, and for alleviating poverty. Marlyn requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and compost for her cassava and vegetable farm. This will give her farming income a big boost. Someday, she hopes to buy land to expand her farming activities and venture into agribusiness to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost for her cassava and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Aleli

texts.en: Aleli earns an income through her food selling business. This is how she supports her husband to sustain their family needs. Aleli is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan for additional working capital to purchase raw ingredients to cook more dishes and be able to expand her business. She is on her way to repaying her loan from her new profits. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to cook more dishes and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar power system for his home

loans.name: Chepkirui

texts.en:
Chepkirui is 28 years old and married. She supports her two children, aged six and four years. Chepkirui runs a retail shop which has lasted for ten years now. 

She is taking her third loan to purchase stock like creams, haircare, jugs, basins and thermoflasks to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her hope and dream is to have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase stock like creams, haircare, jugs and thermoflasks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 32-year-old single lady, who has been providing kitchen and cleaning services in a school since 2013. She is a hard working lady, who puts a lot of effort in improving her living standards and making sure that she can save a small amount of money for her future needs.

Fatima has been suffering from a certain illness for a while, and her limited monthly salary isn't enough to cover the necessary medication needs. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for an urgent surgery she has to undergo.

Fatima hopes that one day she can open her own business, and benefit from a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for an urgent surgery she has to undergo.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is a 61-year-old married woman and a mother of three grownup children from Ormoc City, Leyte. Beatriz makes a living through her sari-sari (convenience) store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Beatriz is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, cooking oil and condiments. Beatriz believes that a loan will help her improve her inventories thus attracting more buyers into her store. In the future, Beatriz hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.ru:
Турсуной 41 летняя жительница городка Турсунзаде. Город был назван в честь великого таджикского современника писателя Мирзо Турсунзаде. 
  Турсуной занимается шитьем одежды на заказ у себя дома. Для нее такая работа является очень удобной. Она может заниматься и домашними делами и работой одновременно. Турсуной обратилась за кредитом, потому что хочет купить новую швейную машинку. За столь время ее деятельности ее машинка испортилась и она вынуждена купить новую, из-за того что у нее мало средств и ей надо сохранить источник кредитования она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Tursunoy is a 41-year-old resident of the city of Tursun-zoda.  The city was named in honor of the great Tajik contemporary writer Mirzo Tursun-zoda.  Tursunoy works as a seamstress making clothing to order out of home.  For her, this kind of job is very convenient.  She can tend to matters at home as well as her job both at the same time.   

Tursunoy has requested a loan as she wants to buy a new sewing machine.  After running for a while for her business, her machine broke and she's forced to buy a new one.  Because she doesn't have very much money and she needs to maintain her source of income, she's requested a loan.

loans.use: acquire a new sewing machine

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
A villager living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Chanthorn is 59 years old. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is dependent on her. She grows cassava on a one hectare lot and works for others to supplement her income. With her current business, she can earn approximately 36,100KHR per day. This is her seventh time applying for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. 

Chanthom will spend her entire loan portion on ploughing the field and buying pesticides, fertilizer and seeds to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to yield more and repair her house to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, pesticides and seeds to support her farmland.

loans.name: Tursunjon

texts.en:
Tursunjon is a 49-year-old widow. She has 22 years of experience in keeping, feeding and selling milking cows. Basically she takes the dairy products from the cows and trades them in the domestic market She is a responsible, active, hardworking and hospitable woman. 

Tursunjon is also a sewer. She sews traditional women's dresses and national blankets in her free time. Now she wants to sew for a living and increase her annual turnover. Tursunjon is asking for financial support to buy textiles and materials to sew. She awaits KIVA lenders' mercy.

loans.use: to buy textiles and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is gaining a profit through her retailing business, buying and selling a variety of commodities like rice in the local community. At the age of 55 and married, she never gets tired of displaying and tending her stall. She has a passion for selling and she earns a meagre income from it that sufficiently supports her family. 

Catalina is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. To expand her resources, Catalina has decided to try her skill in cooking. She wants to engage in a food vending business, for which she has applied for a loan to purchase raw ingredients. Catalina continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Fridah's Group

texts.en:
Fridah's group contains 12 farmers from the Webuye District. It is being represented by Fridah, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 30 years old, is married and has 3 children. Fridah has been a farmer for 12 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Fridah isn’t new to One Acre Fund - she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has learnt a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year, Fridah will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Fridah's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase the amount of milk supplied to customers for more income.

loans.name: Hudson's Group

texts.en:
Hudson is 55 years old and has nine children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by seven farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Hudson has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Hudson also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Hudson's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 29-year-old farmer in Voi, Kenya. He is married and blessed with one son. His wife provides additional income for the family.

Phillip is a farmer, a business he has done for the last one year and he loves it. This marks his first loan from VisonFund Kenya to finance his farming business. He will use the money to purchase fertiliser and seeds, and the anticipated profit to service his loan and pay for produce transportation. 

He hopes his business will continue to flourish in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser and seeds.

loans.name: Choet

texts.en: After struggling for over 30 years to provide for his family, Choet no longer has the burden of supporting his children as they have grown up and have jobs. Nowadays what he wishes, after working hard for so long, is to improve his business and to live a comfortable life under better conditions. Hearing about his neighbor's improved conditions from installing a home solar system, Choet has decided to apply for a KIVA loan to allay his children's concerns and improve his lifestyle. He believes that by installing the solar system, he will reduce his utility expenses and it will be good for the environment.

loans.use: to pay for a solar system for his home

location.town: Chhnok Tru Village,Chhnok Tru Commune, Boribo Dist

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en: Sitha is 58 years old and a married mother of two. Rice farming is the family's main source of income. She also provide labor for a fee during her spare time. After having successfully repaid her previous four loans, Sitha is now leading a group which comprises four female members to apply for loans from VisionFund. Sitha will use her loan portion to buy fertilisers and seedlings and also pay the labor fees for land plowing.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and seeds, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en: Daniela is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. Daniela earns a living through her hog raising business. She has raised pigs for more than nine years now. Daniela would like to take a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. Daniela dreams of making her hog raising business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 22 years old. She is single with one child. She is a dairy farmer, and has been in this business for the last four years. Her monthly income is 16,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase animal feed. She plans to use the profits to improve her living standards. In the future she wants to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Ma. Eldivina

texts.en:
Ma. Eludivina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

NWTF is re-listing Ma. Eludivina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 35-year-old, married man from Dier Al Balah city. He lives with his wife and two kids: a son and a daughter. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. He also has a rickshaw, and he transfers goods on it, but his rickshaw has become very old.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one. This will help him to improve his business and also his income.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw instead of the old one.

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 49 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Gladys has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Gladys also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Gladys's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Fred's Group

texts.en:
Fred, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very reliable person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Fred is representing his group of 14 farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Fred has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting, as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Fred is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 7.5 acres will be planted by Fred's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Elina
