texts.en: Elina is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown-up children. She used to raise pigs in her backyard. As of now, she wants to take a loan to buy new piglets to raise, and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy new piglets to raise, and animal feed

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 35 years old and married to Sarah. They are blessed with three children. He has been in a dairy business for the last five years, and the business earns him a monthly income of 11,000 KES.

Enock has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy a cow to enable him to get school fees to educate his children. His plan is to use the gained profit to repay the loan and start a retail shop.

His future dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a cow to rear for milk production to enable him to get school fees to educate his children.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She wants to take a loan for her hog-raising business. A loan will be used to buy piglets to raise, and animal feed. Lilibeth believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Lilibeth dreams of making her venture a success and profitable. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise, and animal feed

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita, 45, is a businesswoman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has five children. Mercedita runs a small sari-sari or grocery store in her place. She sells various kinds of goods from food products to cleaning agents. She also sells clothes to her customers. Mercedita is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and ready-to-wear products like dresses, pants, shirts and other items. A loan will allow her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and ready-to-wear products like dresses, pants, shirts and other items

loans.name: Margenia

texts.en: Margenia is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She operates a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Margenia has been in the business for more than three years now. She is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments. A loan will help her improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Margenia hopes of expanding her store so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, noodles, rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments for her retail business.

loans.name: Munavvara

texts.en:
Munavvara is 56 years old. She has 22 years of experience of doing business in the market. She is busy with buying and selling fruit corns. Her husband was a famous teacher in a secondary school. After the death of her husband, she felt hard times in her life. It was not easy for her to keep the family and feed the children. She wanted to educate her children because her children would have no problems in the future of their lives. 

She is planning to build a steam room at her house and is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to support her. She needs to build a steam room for cleanliness and daily use. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to build a steam room

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en: Thea is a 23-year-old woman with two children from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. Her two children are dependent on her and still in school. To improve her family’s living, she grows cassava and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. With the current business, she can earn approximately 30,000 KHR per day. This is her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She is the group leader of four members. She will spend her entire loan portion to plow the field, buy fertilizer and pay for laborers who are working on her farmland. She hopes that she can expand her current business and earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to plow the field, buy fertilizer and pay for laborers who are working on her farmland.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Elizabeth has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Elizabeth also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as they will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore, save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Elizabeth's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow to enable her add more stock into her retail business after milk sales.

loans.name: Rasha's Group

texts.en:
Rasha is 49 years old and has eight children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Rasha has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. He also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Rasha's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 56-year-old married father of six children, who has been raising livestock and selling their milk for the past 26 years. 

Ali is an expert in his domain and well known in his region, where most meat dealers visit him because of the good quality they get, in addition to the special encouraging prices he sets. Ali is a hardworking man with a very good reputation, who puts so much effort into developing his business to improve his families living.
 
Today, Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to carry out necessary maintenance for his livestock's sleeping place after the hard winter season they experienced. His previous acquired loans where invested in preparing his business for the autumn/winter season, through buying large quantities of livestock food with special prices.

He proved to be a good standing borrower. Ali is planning to increase his livestock and is working hard to provide his family with a sustainable business income.

loans.use: To carry out necessary maintenance for his livestock's sleeping place after the hard winter season they experienced.

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en: Crestita is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. Crestita earns a living through her hog-raising business. She has raised pigs for more than one year now. Crestita is requesting to take a loan to buy animal feed and more piglets to raise. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy charcoal.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 64 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Corazon has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 42 years old. He is married with three school-going children. He has had a farming business for 15 years. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs for crop production and hopes this will help him to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for crop production to help him to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. Evangeline runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. As of now, she needs a loan to buy groceries to sell. A loan will be used to buy rice, bread and biscuits, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments among others.  This loan will allow her to open up her store again and attract more buyers.

loans.use: to buy rice, bread and biscuits, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments among other items for her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothing.

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es:
La socia  Ricardina pertenece al banco comunal  CHASKA ÑAHUI, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo entre otros, la socia vende la comida a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
Ricardina is a member of the Communal Bank "Chaska Ñahui". She continues to manage her business of selling food. Ricardina is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments. She continues to prepare different types of dishes, such as chicken and rice and other foods. Ricardina sells dishes that all of her customers request. She wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

Ricardina is requesting a loan in order to by oil and other supplies.

loans.use: to by oil and other supplies.

loans.name: Jessica Johanna

texts.es:
Jessica, de 33 años de edad, está acompañada y es madre de 2 niñas, las cuales están estudiando.
Jessica, tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en el comercio, esta actividad ha sido su principal fuente de desarrollo, para la crianza de sus hijas.

Jessica, necesita el préstamo para invertir en más mercadería de la canasta básica para su tienda.

Jessica, sueña en el futuro establecer un local en el centro de la ciudad, donde pueda comercializar sus productos en el corazón del mercado del pueblo, para poder obtener los recursos necesarios para cumplir el sueño de su hija de ser una enfermera al servicio de su pueblo.
texts.en:
Jessica is 33 years old, in a relationship, and the mother of two daughters who are in school. She has more than 10 years of experience in the retail trade. Her business is her main source of development so that she can raise her daughters.

Jessica needs a loan so that she can invest in more basic necessity merchandise for her store. In the future, she dreams of establishing a shop in the center of the city where she can sell her products in the heart of the town market so that she can generate the necessary resources to fulfill her daughter's dream of becoming a nurse who can serve her town.

loans.use: to buy basic necessity merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man and the sole breadwinner for three members of his family. At the age of fourteen, he had to start working to ensure that he could cover his family's living needs and requests.
 
He has been a barber since he was nine years old. In 2008, he established his own shop, and he is working hard to develop it as much as he can to meet his customers' expectations.

Today, his business is going on fine, especially after the previously acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua that was used for necessary maintenance to his shop in order to keep it attractive to his beloved customers. In addition, he was able to increase his business merchandise with special, newly-released beauty products.

To continue this development, his currently requested YOUTH loan will be used to buy a special Barber chair with an attached sink.

He is working hard to reach his dream of expanding his working place and adding a specialized facial treatment department.

loans.use: to buy a special barber chair with an attached sink to continue developing his work space.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is a married woman and the mother of a three-year-old child from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

Hazel is engaged in the retail sale of soft drinks and other beverages. She has been in the business for more than 5 years now. This is the only source of her income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more soft drinks and beverages for her store. In the future, Hazel hopes to expand her business in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 53-year-old mother from the Kakamega region which is located in the western part of Kenya.  She is married to Mr. Earnest who is a businessman and she supports her family of three by providing income.  

For the past 22 years she has operated a kiosk where she sells cereals and makes a monthly income of Kes 30000.  

She is taking her fourth loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase more maize millet and beans to sell to help her earn income to support her family.  She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals like maize, wheat and beans to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina, 56, is a sari-sari store owner from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. 

Josefina would like to take out a loan to buy more merchandise for her store such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, sugar, coffee, bread and biscuits. This loan will enable her to improve her stock and thus attract more buyers into her store. 

In the future, she hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store such as rice, canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, sugar, coffee, bread and biscuits

loans.name: Yusri

texts.en:
Yusri is a 31-year-old, married man from Dier El-Balah City. He lives with his wife and two kids - a son and a daughter. 

Yusri works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also has a store for selling and renting women's dresses. It is a very good business and demand is high.

Yusri has taken out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of dresses for his store, which will help him to improve his business and also his income.

Yusri appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new collection of dresses for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for solar home energy

loans.name: Nen's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng Province, Nen is 32 years old and has six children, three of whom are dependent and still in school. 

To support her family, Nen grows rice on one hectare of land, and she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is Nen's second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as she has fully repaid her past loan. 

In this group of three members, Nen is the group leader. She will use her entire loan portion to plow the field and buy fertilizer to improve her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more yields and earn more income to support all of her children in their studies.

loans.use: to plow the field and buy fertilizer to improve her rice farm

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Agnes's Group

texts.en:
Agnes, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Agnes will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Agnes plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Agnes’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Nissan Group

texts.en:
Mwanakombo, who in her early 30s, is married with three children. Two of them are still in school and the other one is still small.  She has been running two projects: food vending and selling ladies clothes. She works from 9 am to 4 pm daily and after 4 pm she sells her clothes door to door. She has been in this service for eight years now. 

This will be Mwanakombo's 14th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start the clothes business and to increase her mamalishe stock.  She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to pay school fees, buy land, save for loan repayment and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase her mamalishe stock to serve more people and to buy up to date women's clothes like underpants, half petty, bras, etc.  She dreams of building her house.

Mwanakombo will share this loan with her loan group "Nissan", which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her mamalishe stock to serve more poeple and to buy up to date women's clothes, like underpants, half petty and bras

loans.name: Mosab

texts.en: Mosab is a 27-year-old married man from Dier El balah city. He lives with his wife and one son in a small house. Mosab has a store for selling and maintaining mobile phones. This is the only source of income for the family. Mosab would like to improve his store and expand it in the future. Mosab took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products like mobile phones and repair parts for his store. This will increase his sales and also his income. Mosab appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products like mobile phones and repair parts for his store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen  se dedica al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo entre otros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen manages a business of selling dried grains such as corn, wheat, and other products. She wants to move forward with this business. Her dream is to expand her business of selling grain. Carmen is requesting a loan in order to buy corn, barley, and wheat.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley, and wheat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
La socia Diana se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Diana manages a grocery store where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Diana has been in this business for seven years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una joven de 29 años, carismática y emprendedora que desde temprana edad ha luchado por sus sueños. Actualmente se desempeña como responsable de nomina en una compañía nicaragüense. Ella además es estudiante del último año de la carrera de derecho, la cual, es una profesión que desea para complementar sus funciones laborales. Los únicos que la han apoyado siempre son sus padres, quienes son por los que hoy ella sale adelante cada día.  
Ana solicita el crédito ya que desea pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera de derecho para de esta forma crecer profesionalmente. Las metas de esta joven son estudiar inglés y llegar a adquirir un auto pequeño. Sus planes a futuro seguir estudiando a nivel de posgrado. Ella confía y tiene la fe que sus deseos se seguirán cumpliendo.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old. She is a charismatic and enterprising young woman who has strived to pursue her dreams from an early age. Ana is currently in charge of payroll at a Nicaraguan company. She is also a student who is in her final year of study toward a law degree. Ana wants this profession to complement her roles at work. The only ones who have always supported her are her parents and they are the reason why she has been able to get ahead to this day.

Ana is requesting a loan because she wants to pay for a course for her law degree. This will help her to grow professionally. The goals of this young woman are to study English and to acquire a small automobile. Her future plans include continuing her studies at the postgraduate level. She is confident and has faith that her dreams will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to pay for a course for her law degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is a 28 year old man from Kisumu. He supports 4 people in his family, his children are 11, 8, 5 and 2 ½ years old respectively.

He operates a motorcycle transport business which he has done for the last 6 years and generates a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

He is taking his first loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which he will use to purchase another motorcycle in order to increase his income and support his family more stably.

Alphonce will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business and educate his children.

His dream is to have business stability.

loans.use: to purchase a motor bike for his business.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en: Leonard is 27 years old. He is married with one child, two years old, who he supports. He is a farmer growing wheat and potatoes and has been in this business for six years now. He is taking a third loan from VisionFund Kenya and he has repaid his previous loans successfully. He will be using this loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds for planting on his farm. This will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and get more income to support his family. His future hopes and dreams are to grow more cash crops and be successful.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds to plant more wheat and potatoes and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Lekitony

texts.en:
Lekitony is 52 years old and married. He has five children aged between 17 and 13 years of whom he supports. 

Lekitony has been growing wheat for 10 years now. He is taking his first loan to purchase fertilizer and chemicals for his farm. 

He intends to use the anticipated profit to expand his current business. His hope and dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and chemicals for his farm

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan is 40 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 7 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Susan has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Susan also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Susan's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia's Group was formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Lydia, who is the group leader, pictured above. She is 25 years old, married and has four children. Lydia has been a farmer for 18 years and is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Lydia isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Lydia will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Lydia's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer, to improve her maize harvests.

loans.name: Sadeq

texts.en:
Sadig received his first loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a laptop for personal use. He has completed the repayment of all the installments of that loan. He applied for a second loan of 350,000 YER from Kiva Lenders to buy furniture for his house. With this loan, he will purchase a cupboard, bunk beds, as well as bedroom furniture for his house. Purchasing this furniture will support the family with a suitable living condition and Sadig's wife will be able to invite her neighbors to sit together inside their house happily. Taking this loan to furnish the house will give Sadig the opportunity to purchase necessary appliances as a refrigerator and a washing machine because he doesn't have them now.
Sadig thanks Kiva lenders for their first loan and hopes this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: To buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for solar home energy

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom and her husband (shown in the photo) own a small grocery shop with 2 dependent children. Beside their small business at home, Sreymom owns one hectare of land for farming. She needs a lot of energy to run her business until night time. However, the car battery is not reliable to  provide for the business electricity needs. The battery runs out without any notice. She has no choice but stay in pitch black until morning. She is applying for a KIVA loan to buy solar home systems for her business’s energy needs and also her family's usage.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Buk Toek Village, Preaek Brasab Commune, Preaek Br

loans.name: Anzurat

texts.en: Anzurat is a hardworking woman. She was born in a family of farmers. She lives in a village and is married. She has two children and also has grandchildren. She is a lucky grandmother and likes to be hospitable and kind. She has a business of buying and selling dried fruits at the market. She has about ten years experience doing this. She lives in poor conditions and her house is in ill repair. She has no walls in her house and wants to have them. She is seeking financial support from KIVA lenders to renovate her house. She needs to buy construction supplies. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, de 32 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad.

Juan, no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, pero se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 15 años, el trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, desde muy pequeño le enseño a trabajar muy fuerte, el trabajo lo tiene a una distancia de su vivienda de 1 kilómetro y el horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 m.d.

Con el crédito comprará abono, pesticidas y pagara el arrendamiento del terreno donde sembrará el próximo cultivo, ya que tiene que tener lo necesario para poder empezar a trabajar la tierra.

Su sueño es darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old and only completed school through the third grade. He is married and his partner takes care of the household duties. They have a six-year-old son.

Juan does not have any type of business, but he has worked in agriculture for more than 15 years. He learned the trade from his father. As a young boy he learned about hard work. Juan must travel a distance of one kilometer from his house in order to perform his work. His work schedule is from 6:00 A.M. to 12 noon.

Juan will use the loan to buy compost and pesticides. He will also pay the rent on the plot of land where he will plant his next crop. The loan will give him everything he needs to begin working the land.

His dream is to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for compost, pesticides, and the rent on the plot of land where he will plant his next crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde, asi como también una panadería, ella tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la actividad de granja e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para mejorar el lugar donde los mantiene que ese le que muestra la fotografía y también concentrado para su desarrollo y asi poder seguir con la crianza para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Rosario is 59 years old and lives in her own home with her partner. She earns a living breeding and selling broiler chickens as well as baked goods. She has been farming for 7 years and started this with her own money. She sells her products in the surrounding areas from where she lives and with what she earns she manages to pay for some of her household expenses. She is asking for a loan to improve the place where she keeps the chickens which is shown in this photograph and also to buy chicken feed for the development and so as to be able to continue breeding and earning a better income.

loans.use: to improve her farm and to buy chicken feed to develop it.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en: Ma. Gina is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two children.  She lives with her family in Ormoc City, Leyte. Ma. Gina wants to improve her sari-sari store or grocery store business but lacks the capital to do so. With this, she would like to take a loan to buy stock to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and detergents, cooking oil and condiments, soft drinks, bread and biscuits, among other items. A loan will be a great help for her in improving her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and detergents, cooking oil and condiments, soft drinks, bread and biscuits, among other items

loans.name: Liselda

texts.en: Liselda is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Liselda is asking to take a loan from CEVI to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. Liselda’s future dreams include the expansion of her business in order to generate more revenue and to save money for her children’s school expenses.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Famille Siringi Group

texts.fr: Le café est une culture respectée à IDJWI de sorte qu'un caféiculteur a aisément accès à un prêt qu'un autre cultivateur. Cela est la raison pour laquelle Imani s'est engagé dans cette activité. Pour lui, le temps est long jusqu'à la récolte, ce qui fait à ce que le caféiculteur vend petit à petit sa production afin de répondre à certains besoins sociaux. Vivant avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans le domaine familial, il souhaiterait se contruire une maison hors de la concession. Il pose sur la photo avec son épouse portant leur jeune enfant.
texts.en:
Coffee is a respected crop in IDJWI, so coffee farmers have easier access to loans than other types of farmers. It is for this reason that Imani started in this business.

For him, the time is long until the harvest, which means that he has to sell his crop little by little to respond to various social needs.

Living with his wife and their children in a residential area, he wishes to build a house outside of their neighborhood.

He is standing in the photo with his wife, who is carrying their young child.

loans.use: to weed and harvest

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Jane will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Jane plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total, Jane’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Famille Bambaga Group

texts.fr: A son mariage en 1982, Stany s'est lancé dans la culture du café épaulé par son épouse. C'est grâce à cette activité qu'il a réalisé différents projets et supporté les charges de sa famille. Ce qui est gênant pour lui  ce sont les taxes exhorbitantes qu'ils doivent payer et l'absence d'un marché sûr d'écoulement, ainsi ils sont obligés de faire la traversée dans les pays limitrophes pour vendre leurs produits à leur risque et péril. Il souhaite avoir une bonne récolte pour cette saison. Il pose sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en:
After his marriage in 1982, Stany started farming coffee with his wife. Thanks to this work he has completed different projects and has supported his family's expenses. 

His challenge is the large amount of taxes that he must pay and the absence of a market to sell his crops, which forces him to travel to neighboring countries to sell his crops at his own risk and peril.

Stany wishes to have a good harvest this season. 

He is standing in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for labor to weed and harvest

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Hanine

texts.en:
Hanine is 24 years old and married. She started her own clothes and perfume business in 2014 so that she can support herself as her beloved husband is working abroad to insure a better future for their family.
Hanine's business is doing alright, but just like most businesses, she needs additional external financial support to develop, and introduce her customers to new items.
Thus, for this reason, Hanine is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to diversify her merchandise to include newly released bed shields, blankets and underwear, especially with spring and summer designs.
She hopes of expanding and developing her business so that her husband can come back home and run their business together.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise to include newly released bed shields, blankets and underwear

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Los Pinos De Lahuachaca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS DE LAHUACHACA” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lizith es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de carne de pollo, venta de carne de res, venta de comida, venta de ollas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lizith es integrante, ella indica que es la primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ollas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, por herencia de sus padres, mismos que trabajaban con el mismo negocio y ella apoyaba desde niña.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ollas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Los Pinos de Lahuachaca' are going to begin their ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Patacamaya regional office. The group is made up of eight members, and it is directed by a committee of which Señora Lizith is the president. The members of the group run various businesses. Among them are: a grocery store, and businesses selling vegetables, poultry, beef, food and cooking pots. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit these small business owners, including Señora Lizith. She says that it is her first year working with Pro Mujer, and that she joined because of a marketing campaign in her local area. Currently, she has a business selling cooking pots. She says that she was taught this business by her parents over many years. They used to run the business, and she would help them when she was a child.  

The loan she is taking out will be used to increase her capital by purchasing cooking pots at wholesale. She will buy them from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz, and after she will sell them at her stall. This way of working allows her to make money and support her family economically, as she is married and has two children. 

When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said that she liked the training opportunities that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cooking pots at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits
